params.name: y

params.description: Z-coordinate of the cube center.
params.name: z

params.description: Half dimension of the cube.
params.name: scale

returns.description: true if entities were found and the file was written, otherwise false.

description: Pastes the contents of the clipboard into the domain.
name: pasteEntities

params.description: The position to paste the clipboard contents at.
params.name: position

returns.description:
The IDs of the new entities that were created as a result of the paste operation. If entities couldn't 
    be created then an empty array is returned.

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Controller API provides facilities to interact with computer and controller hardware.

Facilities

Properties

Get Controller property trees.

  • {@link Controller.getActions|getActions}
  • {@link Controller.getHardware|getHardware}
  • {@link Controller.getStandard|getStandard}

Mappings

Create and enable or disable Controller mappings.

  • {@link Controller.disableMapping|disableMapping}
  • {@link Controller.enableMapping|enableMapping}
  • {@link Controller.loadMapping|loadMapping}
  • {@link Controller.newMapping|newMapping}
  • {@link Controller.parseMapping|parseMapping}

Input, Hardware, and Action Reflection

Information on the devices and actions available.

  • {@link Controller.findAction|findAction}
  • {@link Controller.findDevice|findDevice}
  • {@link Controller.getActionNames|getActionNames}
  • {@link Controller.getAllActions|getAllActions}
  • {@link Controller.getAvailableInputs|getAvailableInputs}
  • {@link Controller.getDeviceName|getDeviceName}
  • {@link Controller.getDeviceNames|getDeviceNames}
  • {@link Controller.getRunningInputDevices|getRunningInputDevices}

Input, Hardware, and Action Signals

Notifications of device and action events.

  • {@link Controller.actionEvent|actionEvent}
  • {@link Controller.hardwareChanged|hardwareChanged}
  • {@link Controller.inputDeviceRunningChanged|inputDeviceRunningChanged}
  • {@link Controller.inputEvent|inputEvent}

Mouse, Keyboard, and Touch Signals

Notifications of mouse, keyboard, and touch events.

  • {@link Controller.keyPressEvent|keyPressEvent}
  • {@link Controller.keyReleaseEvent|keyReleaseEvent}
  • {@link Controller.mouseDoublePressEvent|mouseDoublePressEvent}
  • {@link Controller.mouseMoveEvent|mouseMoveEvent}
  • {@link Controller.mousePressEvent|mousePressEvent}
  • {@link Controller.mouseReleaseEvent|mouseReleaseEvent}
  • {@link Controller.touchBeginEvent|touchBeginEvent}
  • {@link Controller.touchEndEvent|touchEndEvent}
  • {@link Controller.touchUpdateEvent|touchUpdateEvent}
  • {@link Controller.wheelEvent|wheelEvent}

Control Capturing

Disable and enable the processing of mouse and touch events.

  • {@link Controller.captureMouseEvents|captureMouseEvents}
  • {@link Controller.captureWheelEvents|captureWheelEvents}
  • {@link Controller.captureTouchEvents|captureTouchEvents}
  • {@link Controller.releaseMouseEvents|releaseMouseEvents}
  • {@link Controller.releaseWheelEvents|releaseWheelEvents}
  • {@link Controller.releaseTouchEvents|releaseTouchEvents}

Action Capturing

Disable and enable controller actions.

  • {@link Controller.captureActionEvents|captureActionEvents}
  • {@link Controller.captureKeyEvents|captureKeyEvents}
  • {@link Controller.captureJoystick|captureJoystick}
  • {@link Controller.captureEntityClickEvents|captureEntityClickEvents}
  • {@link Controller.releaseActionEvents|releaseActionEvents}
  • {@link Controller.releaseKeyEvents|releaseKeyEvents}
  • {@link Controller.releaseJoystick|releaseJoystick}
  • {@link Controller.releaseEntityClickEvents|releaseEntityClickEvents}

Controller and Action Values

Get the current value of controller outputs and actions.

  • {@link Controller.getValue|getValue}
  • {@link Controller.getAxisValue|getAxisValue}
  • {@link Controller.getPoseValue|getPoseValue}
  • {@link Controller.getActionValue|getActionValue}

Haptics

Trigger haptic pulses.

  • {@link Controller.triggerHapticPulse|triggerHapticPulse}
  • {@link Controller.triggerHapticPulseOnDevice|triggerHapticPulseOnDevice}
  • {@link Controller.triggerShortHapticPulse|triggerShortHapticPulse}
  • {@link Controller.triggerShortHapticPulseOnDevice|triggerShortHapticPulseOnDevice}

Display Information

Get information on the display.

  • {@link Controller.getViewportDimensions|getViewportDimensions}
  • {@link Controller.getRecommendedHUDRect|getRecommendedHUDRect}

Virtual Game Pad

Use the virtual game pad which is available on some devices.

  • {@link Controller.setVPadEnabled|setVPadEnabled}
  • {@link Controller.setVPadHidden|setVPadHidden}
  • {@link Controller.setVPadExtraBottomMargin|setVPadExtraBottomMargin}

Input Recordings

Create and play input recordings.

  • {@link Controller.startInputRecording|startInputRecording}
  • {@link Controller.stopInputRecording|stopInputRecording}
  • {@link Controller.saveInputRecording|saveInputRecording}
  • {@link Controller.getInputRecorderSaveDirectory|getInputRecorderSaveDirectory}
  • {@link Controller.loadInputRecording|loadInputRecording}
  • {@link Controller.startInputPlayback|startInputPlayback}
  • {@link Controller.stopInputPlayback|stopInputPlayback}

Entity Methods

The default scripts implement hand controller actions that use {@link Entities.callEntityMethod} to call entity script methods, if present, in the entity being interacted with.

Method NameDescriptionExample
startFarTrigger
continueFarTrigger
stopFarTrigger		 These methods are called when a user is more than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is triggerable, and the user starts, continues, or stops squeezing the trigger. A light switch that can be toggled on and off from a distance.
startNearTrigger
continueNearTrigger
stopNearTrigger		 These methods are called when a user is less than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is triggerable, and the user starts, continues, or stops squeezing the trigger. A doorbell that can be rung when a user is near.
startDistanceGrab
continueDistanceGrab
 These methods are called when a user is more than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is either cloneable, or grabbable and not locked, and the user starts or continues to squeeze the trigger. A comet that emits icy particle trails when a user is dragging it through the sky.
startNearGrab
continueNearGrab
 These methods are called when a user is less than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is either cloneable, or grabbable and not locked, and the user starts or continues to squeeze the trigger. A ball that glows when it's being held close.
releaseGrab This method is called when a user releases the trigger when having been either distance or near grabbing an entity. Turn off the ball glow or comet trail with the user finishes grabbing it.
startEquip
continueEquip
releaseEquip		 These methods are called when a user starts, continues, or stops equipping an entity. A glass that stays in the user's hand after the trigger is clicked.

All the entity methods are called with the following two arguments:

  • The entity ID.
  • A string, "hand,userID" — where "hand" is "left" or "right", and "userID" is the user's {@link MyAvatar|MyAvatar.sessionUUID}.
name: Controller

properties.description:
Predefined actions on Interface and the user's avatar. These can be used as end points in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. A synonym for Controller.Hardware.Actions. Read-only.

Default mappings are provided from the Controller.Hardware.Keyboard and Controller.Standard to actions in keyboardMouse.json and standard.json, respectively.
properties.name: Actions

properties.description: Standard and hardware-specific controller and computer outputs, plus predefined actions on Interface and the user's avatar. The outputs can be mapped to Actions or functions in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. Additionally, hardware-specific controller outputs can be mapped to Controller.Standard controller outputs. Read-only.
properties.name: Hardware

properties.description:
Standard controller outputs that can be mapped to Actions or functions in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. Read-only.

Each hardware device has a mapping from its outputs to Controller.Standard items, specified in a JSON file. For example, leapmotion.json and vive.json.
properties.name: Standard

description: Disables default Interface actions for a particular key event.
name: captureKeyEvents

params.description: Details of the key event to be captured. The key property must be specified. The text property is ignored. The other properties default to false.
params.name: event

examples:
<caption>Disable left and right strafing.</caption>
var STRAFE_LEFT = { "key": 16777234, isShifted: true };
var STRAFE_RIGHT = { "key": 16777236, isShifted: true };

Controller.captureKeyEvents(STRAFE_LEFT);
Controller.captureKeyEvents(STRAFE_RIGHT);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.releaseKeyEvents(STRAFE_LEFT);
    Controller.releaseKeyEvents(STRAFE_RIGHT);
});

description:
Re-enables default Interface actions for a particular key event that has been disabled using 
{@link Controller.captureKeyEvents|captureKeyEvents}.
name: releaseKeyEvents

params.description: Details of the key event to release from capture. The key property must be specified. The text property is ignored. The other properties default to false.
params.name: event

description: Disables default Interface actions for a joystick.
name: captureJoystick

params.description: The integer ID of the joystick.
params.name: joystickID

deprecated: This function is deprecated and will be removed. It no longer has any effect.

description:
Re-enables default Interface actions for a joystick that has been disabled using 
{@link Controller.captureJoystick|captureJoystick}.
name: releaseJoystick

params.description: The integer ID of the joystick.
params.name: joystickID

deprecated: This function is deprecated and will be removed. It no longer has any effect.

description: Disables {@link Entities.mousePressOnEntity} and {@link Entities.mouseDoublePressOnEntity} events on entities.
name: captureEntityClickEvents
examples:
<caption>Disable entity click events for a short period.</caption>
Entities.mousePressOnEntity.connect(function (entityID, event) {
    print("Clicked on entity: " + entityID);
});

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Controller.captureEntityClickEvents();
}, 5000);

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Controller.releaseEntityClickEvents();
}, 10000);

description:
Re-enables {@link Entities.mousePressOnEntity} and {@link Entities.mouseDoublePressOnEntity} events on entities that were 
disabled using {@link Controller.captureEntityClickEvents|captureEntityClickEvents}.

description: The possible docking locations of an InteractiveWindow.

The window is displayed separately from the Interface window, as its

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Desktop API provides the dimensions of the computer screen, sets the opacity of the HUD surface, and enables QML and HTML windows to be shown inside or outside of Interface.
name: Desktop

properties.description: The width of the computer screen including task bar and system menu, in pixels. Read-only.
properties.name: width

properties.description: The height of the computer screen including task bar and system menu, in pixels. Read-only.
properties.name: height

properties.description: A flag value that makes an {@link InteractiveWindow} always display on top. Read-only.
properties.name: ALWAYS_ON_TOP

properties.description: A flag value that makes an {@link InteractiveWindow} hide instead of closing when the user clicks the "close" button. Read-only.
properties.name: CLOSE_BUTTON_HIDES

properties.description: The possible display options for an {@link InteractiveWindow}: display inside Interface or in a separate desktop window. Read-only.
properties.name: PresentationMode

properties.description: The possible docking locations of an {@link InteractiveWindow}: top, bottom, left, or right of the Interface window. Read-only.
properties.name: DockArea

properties.description: The possible "relative position anchors" for an {@link InteractiveWindow}: top left, top right, bottom right, or bottom left of the Interface window. Read-only.
properties.name: RelativePositionAnchor

description: Sets the opacity of the HUD surface.
name: setHUDAlpha

params.description: The opacity, 0.0 – 1.0.
params.name: alpha

description:
Opens a QML window within Interface: in the Interface window in desktop mode or on the HUD surface in HMD mode. If a 
window of the specified name already exists, it is shown, otherwise a new window is created from the QML.
name: show

params.description: The QML file that specifies the window content.
params.name: url

params.description: A unique name for the window.
params.name: name

examples:
<caption>Open the general settings dialog.</caption>
Desktop.show("hifi/dialogs/GeneralPreferencesDialog.qml", "GeneralPreferencesDialog");

description: Creates a new window that can be displayed either within Interface or as a separate desktop window.
name: createWindow

params.description: The QML file that specifies the window content. The QML file can use a WebView control (defined by "WebView.qml" included in the Interface install) to embed an HTML web page (complete with EventBridge object).
params.name: url

params.description: Initial window properties.
params.name: properties

returns.description: A new window object.

examples:
<caption>Open a dialog in its own window separate from Interface.</caption>
var nativeWindow = Desktop.createWindow(Script.resourcesPath() + 'qml/OverlayWindowTest.qml', {
    title: "Native Window",
    presentationMode: Desktop.PresentationMode.NATIVE,
    size: { x: 500, y: 400 }
});

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    nativeWindow.close();
});

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The GooglePoly API allows you to interact with Google Poly models direct from inside High Fidelity.
name: GooglePoly

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The HMD API provides access to the HMD used in VR display mode.
name: HMD

properties.description: The position of the HMD if currently in VR display mode, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}. Read-only.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The orientation of the HMD if currently in VR display mode, otherwise {@link Quat(0)|Quat.IDENTITY}. Read-only.
properties.name: orientation

properties.description: true if the display mode is HMD, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: active

properties.description: true if currently in VR display mode and the HMD is being worn, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: mounted

properties.description: The real-world height of the user. Read-only. Currently always returns a value of 1.755.
properties.name: playerHeight

properties.description: The real-world height of the user's eyes. Read-only. Currently always returns a value of 1.655.
properties.name: eyeHeight

properties.description: The inter-pupillary distance (distance between eyes) of the user, used for rendering. Defaults to the human average of 0.064 unless set by the HMD. Read-only.
properties.name: ipd

properties.description: A scale factor applied to the ipd property value.
properties.name: ipdScale

properties.description: true if the tablet is being displayed, false otherwise. Read-only.
properties.name: showTablet

properties.description: true if the tablet has been opened in contextual mode, otherwise false. In contextual mode, the tablet has been opened at a specific world position and orientation rather than at a position and orientation relative to the user. Read-only.
properties.name: tabletContextualMode

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet body model entity.
properties.name: tabletID

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet's screen entity.
properties.name: tabletScreenID

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet's "home" button entity.
properties.name: homeButtonID

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet's "home" button highlight entity.
properties.name: homeButtonHighlightID

properties.description: The UUID of the mini tablet's body model entity. null if not in HMD mode.
properties.name: miniTabletID

properties.description: The UUID of the mini tablet's screen entity. null if not in HMD mode.
properties.name: miniTabletScreenID

properties.description: The hand that the mini tablet is displayed on: 0 for left hand, 1 for right hand, -1 if not in HMD mode.
properties.name: miniTabletHand

properties.description: true if the mini tablet is enabled to be displayed, otherwise false.
properties.name: miniTabletEnabled

properties.description: The size and position of the HMD play area in sensor coordinates. Read-only.
properties.name: playArea

properties.description: The positions of the VR system sensors in sensor coordinates. Read-only.
properties.name: sensorPositions

properties.description: The amount of vision squeeze for the x-axis when moving, range 0.0 – 1.0.
properties.name: visionSqueezeRatioX

properties.description: The amount of vision squeeze for the y-axis when moving, range 0.0 – 1.0.
properties.name: visionSqueezeRatioY

properties.description: The additional amount of vision squeeze for the x-axis when turning, range 0.0 – 1.0.
properties.name: visionSqueezeTurningXFactor

properties.description: Currently unused.
properties.name: visionSqueezeTurningYFactor

properties.description:
The delay in undoing the vision squeeze effect after motion stops, in
    seconds.
properties.name: visionSqueezeUnSqueezeDelay

properties.description: How quickly the vision squeeze effect fades, once visionSqueezeUnSqueezeDelay has passed.
properties.name: visionSqueezeUnSqueezeSpeed

properties.description: How tightly vision is squeezed, range 0.01 – 0.7.
properties.name: visionSqueezeTransition

properties.description: 1 if each eye gets a tube to see through, 0 if the face gets a tube.
properties.name: visionSqueezePerEye

properties.description: Adjusts how far below the camera the vision squeeze grid is displayed at.
properties.name: visionSqueezeGroundPlaneY

properties.description:
The diameter of the circle of vision squeeze grid that is illuminated 
    around the camera.
properties.name: visionSqueezeSpotlightSize

description: Calculates the intersection of a ray with the HUD overlay.
name: calculateRayUICollisionPoint

params.description: The origin of the ray.
params.name: position

params.description: The direction of the ray.
params.name: direction

returns.description: The point of intersection with the HUD overlay if it intersects, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}.

examples:
<caption>Draw a square on the HUD overlay in the direction you're looking.</caption>
var hudIntersection = HMD.calculateRayUICollisionPoint(MyAvatar.getHeadPosition(),
    Quat.getForward(MyAvatar.headOrientation));
var hudPoint = HMD.overlayFromWorldPoint(hudIntersection);

var DIMENSIONS = { x: 50, y: 50 };
var square = Overlays.addOverlay("rectangle", {
    x: hudPoint.x - DIMENSIONS.x / 2,
    y: hudPoint.y - DIMENSIONS.y / 2,
    width: DIMENSIONS.x,
    height: DIMENSIONS.y,
    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 }
});

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Overlays.deleteOverlay(square);
});

description:
Gets the 2D HUD overlay coordinates of a 3D point on the HUD overlay.
2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay.
name: overlayFromWorldPoint

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in world coordinates.
params.name: position

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.

examples:
<caption>Draw a square on the HUD overlay in the direction you're looking.</caption>
var hudIntersection = HMD.calculateRayUICollisionPoint(MyAvatar.getHeadPosition(),
    Quat.getForward(MyAvatar.headOrientation));
var hudPoint = HMD.overlayFromWorldPoint(hudIntersection);

var DIMENSIONS = { x: 50, y: 50 };
var square = Overlays.addOverlay("rectangle", {
    x: hudPoint.x - DIMENSIONS.x / 2,
    y: hudPoint.y - DIMENSIONS.y / 2,
    width: DIMENSIONS.x,
    height: DIMENSIONS.y,
    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 }
});

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Overlays.deleteOverlay(square);
});

description:
Gets the 3D world coordinates of a 2D point on the HUD overlay.
2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay.
name: worldPointFromOverlay

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.
params.name: coordinates

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in world coordinates.

description: Gets the 2D point on the HUD overlay represented by given spherical coordinates. 2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay. Spherical coordinates are polar coordinates in radians with { x: 0, y: 0 } being the center of the HUD overlay.
name: sphericalToOverlay

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in spherical coordinates.
params.name: sphericalPos

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.

description: Gets the spherical coordinates of a 2D point on the HUD overlay. 2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay. Spherical coordinates are polar coordinates in radians with { x: 0, y: 0 } being the center of the HUD overlay.
name: overlayToSpherical

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.
params.name: overlayPos

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in spherical coordinates.

description: Recenters the HMD HUD to the current HMD position and orientation.

description: Checks whether there is an HMD available.
name: isHMDAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD to check for, e.g., "Oculus Rift". The name is the same as may be displayed in Interface's "Display" menu. If no name is specified, then any HMD matches.
params.name: name

returns.description: true if an HMD of the specified name is available, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Report on HMD availability.</caption>
print("Is any HMD available: " + HMD.isHMDAvailable());
print("Is an Oculus Rift HMD available: " + HMD.isHMDAvailable("Oculus Rift"));
print("Is a Vive HMD available: " + HMD.isHMDAvailable("OpenVR (Vive)"));

description: Checks whether there is an HMD head controller available.
name: isHeadControllerAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD head controller to check for, e.g., "Oculus". If no name is specified, then any HMD head controller matches.
params.name: name

returns.description: true if an HMD head controller of the specified name is available, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Report HMD head controller availability.</caption>
print("Is any HMD head controller available: " + HMD.isHeadControllerAvailable());
print("Is an Oculus head controller available: " + HMD.isHeadControllerAvailable("Oculus"));
print("Is a Vive head controller available: " + HMD.isHeadControllerAvailable("OpenVR"));

description: Checks whether there are HMD hand controllers available.
name: isHandControllerAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD hand controller to check for, e.g., "Oculus". If no name is specified, then any HMD hand controller matches.
params.name: name

returns.description: true if an HMD hand controller of the specified name is available, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Report HMD hand controller availability.</caption>
print("Are any HMD hand controllers available: " + HMD.isHandControllerAvailable());
print("Are Oculus hand controllers available: " + HMD.isHandControllerAvailable("Oculus"));
print("Are Vive hand controllers available: " + HMD.isHandControllerAvailable("OpenVR"));

description: Checks whether there are specific HMD controllers available.
name: isSubdeviceContainingNameAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD controller to check for, e.g., "OculusTouch".
params.name: name

returns.description: true if an HMD controller with a name containing the specified name is available, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Report if particular Oculus controllers are available.</caption>
print("Is an Oculus Touch controller available: " + HMD.isSubdeviceContainingNameAvailable("Touch"));
print("Is an Oculus Remote controller available: " + HMD.isSubdeviceContainingNameAvailable("Remote"));

description:
Signals that models of the HMD hand controllers being used should be displayed. The models are displayed at their actual, 
real-world locations.
name: requestShowHandControllers
examples:
<caption>Show your hand controllers for 10 seconds.</caption>
HMD.requestShowHandControllers();
Script.setTimeout(function () {
    HMD.requestHideHandControllers();
}, 10000);

description:
Signals that it is no longer necessary to display models of the HMD hand controllers being used. If no other scripts 
want the models displayed then they are no longer displayed.
name: requestHideHandControllers

description:
Checks whether any script wants models of the HMD hand controllers displayed. Requests are made and canceled using 
{@link HMD.requestShowHandControllers|requestShowHandControllers} and 
{@link HMD.requestHideHandControllers|requestHideHandControllers}.
name: shouldShowHandControllers

returns.description: true if any script is requesting that HMD hand controller models be displayed.

description:
Causes the borders in HUD windows to be enlarged when the laser intersects them in HMD mode. By default, borders are not 
enlarged.

description:
Causes the border in HUD windows to no longer be enlarged when the laser intersects them in HMD mode. By default, 
borders are not enlarged.

description:
Suppresses the activation of the HMD-provided keyboard, if any. Successful calls should be balanced with a call to 
{@link HMD.unsuppressKeyboard|unsuppressKeyboard} within a reasonable amount of time.
name: suppressKeyboard

returns.description: true if the current HMD provides a keyboard and it was successfully suppressed (e.g., it isn't being displayed), otherwise false.

description:
Opens the tablet if the tablet is used in the current display mode and it isn't already showing, and sets the tablet to 
contextual mode if requested. In contextual mode, the page displayed on the tablet is wholly controlled by script (i.e., 
the user cannot navigate to another).
name: openTablet

params.description: If true then the tablet is opened at a specific position and orientation already set by the script, otherwise it opens at a position and orientation relative to the user. For contextual mode, set the world or local position and orientation of the HMD.tabletID overlay.
params.name: contextualMode

description:
Triggered when a request to show or hide models of the HMD hand controllers is made using 
{@link HMD.requestShowHandControllers|requestShowHandControllers} or
{@link HMD.requestHideHandControllers|requestHideHandControllers}.

<caption>Report when showing of hand controllers changes.</caption>
function onShouldShowHandControllersChanged() {
    print("Should show hand controllers: " + HMD.shouldShowHandControllers());
}
HMD.shouldShowHandControllersChanged.connect(onShouldShowHandControllersChanged);

HMD.requestShowHandControllers();
Script.setTimeout(function () {
    HMD.requestHideHandControllers();

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Keyboard API provides facilities to use an in-world, virtual keyboard. When enabled, this keyboard is displayed instead of the 2D keyboard that raises at the bottom of the tablet or Web entities when a text input field has focus and you're in HMD mode.
name: Keyboard

properties.description: true if the virtual keyboard is visible, false if it isn't.
properties.name: raised

properties.description: true if "*"s are displayed on the virtual keyboard's display instead of the characters typed, false if the actual characters are displayed.
properties.name: password

properties.description: true if user settings have "Use Virtual Keyboard" enabled, false if it's disabled. Read-only.
properties.name: use3DKeyboard

properties.description: true if user settings for the virtual keyboard have "Mallets" selected, false if "Lasers" is selected. Read-only.
properties.name: preferMalletsOverLasers

description:
Loads a JSON file that defines the virtual keyboard's layout. The default JSON file used is 
{@link https://github.com/highfidelity/hifi/blob/master/interface/resources/config/keyboard.json|https://github.com/highfidelity/hifi/.../keyboard.json}.
name: loadKeyboardFile

params.description: The keyboard JSON file.
params.name: path

description: Enables the left mallet so that it is displayed when in HMD mode.
name: enableLeftMallet

description: Enables the right mallet so that it is displayed when in HMD mode.
name: enableRightMallet

description: Disables the left mallet so that it is not displayed when in HMD mode.
name: disableLeftMallet

description: Disables the right mallet so that it is not displayed when in HMD mode.
name: disableRightMallet

description: Configures the virtual keyboard to recognize a ray pointer as the left hand's laser.
name: setLeftHandLaser

params.description: The ID of a ray pointer created by {@link Pointers.createPointer}.
params.name: leftHandLaser

description: Configures the virtual keyboard to recognize a ray pointer as the right hand's laser.
name: setRightHandLaser

params.description: The ID of a ray pointer created by {@link Pointers.createPointer}.
params.name: rightHandLaser

description: Checks whether an entity is part of the virtual keyboard.
name: containsID

params.description: The entity ID.
params.name: entityID

returns.description: true if the entity is part of the virtual keyboard, false if it isn't.

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Menu API provides access to the menu that is displayed at the top of the window on a user's desktop and in the tablet when the "MENU" button is pressed.

Groupings

A "grouping" provides a way to group a set of menus or menu items together so that they can all be set visible or invisible as a group.

There is currently only one available group: "Developer". This grouping can be toggled in the "Settings" menu.

If a menu item doesn't belong to a group, it is always displayed.
name: Menu

description: Adds a new top-level menu.
name: addMenu

params.description: Name that will be displayed for the menu. Nested menus can be specified using the ">" character.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the grouping, if any, to add this menu to.
params.name: grouping

examples:
<caption>Add a menu and a nested submenu.</caption>
Menu.addMenu("Test Menu");
Menu.addMenu("Test Menu > Test Sub Menu");

<caption>Add a menu to the Settings menu that is only visible if Settings > Developer is enabled.</caption>
Menu.addMenu("Settings > Test Grouping Menu", "Developer");

description: Removes a top-level menu.
name: removeMenu

params.description: Name of the menu to remove.
params.name: menuName

examples:
<caption>Remove a menu and nested submenu.</caption>
Menu.removeMenu("Test Menu > Test Sub Menu");
Menu.removeMenu("Test Menu");

description: Checks whether a top-level menu exists.
name: menuExists

params.description: Name of the menu to check exists.
params.name: menuName

returns.description: true if the menu exists, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Check if the "Developer" menu exists.</caption>
if (Menu.menuExists("Developer")) {
    print("Developer menu exists.");
}

description:
Adds a separator with an unclickable label below it. The separator will be placed at the bottom of the menu. To add a 
separator at a specific point in the menu, use {@link Menu.addMenuItem} with {@link Menu.MenuItemProperties} instead.
name: addSeparator

params.description: Name of the menu to add the separator to.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the separator that will be displayed as the label below the separator line.
params.name: separatorName

examples:
<caption>Add a separator.</caption>
Menu.addSeparator("Developer", "Test Separator");

description: Removes a separator from a menu.
name: removeSeparator

params.description: Name of the menu to remove the separator from.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the separator to remove.
params.name: separatorName

examples:
<caption>Remove a separator.</caption>
Menu.removeSeparator("Developer", "Test Separator");

description: Adds a new menu item to a menu. The menu item is specified using {@link Menu.MenuItemProperties}.
name: addMenuItem

params.description: Properties of the menu item to create.
params.name: properties

examples:
<caption>Add a menu item at a particular position in the "Developer" menu.</caption>
Menu.addMenuItem({
    menuName:     "Developer",
    menuItemName: "Test",
    afterItem:    "Log",
    shortcutKey:  "Ctrl+Shift+T"
});

description: Adds a new menu item to a menu. The new item is added at the end of the menu.
name: addMenuItem

params.description: Name of the menu to add the menu item to.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the menu item. This is what will be displayed in the menu.
params.name: menuItem

params.description: A shortcut key that can be used to trigger the menu item.
params.name: shortcutKey

examples:
<caption>Add a menu item to the end of the "Developer" menu.</caption>
Menu.addMenuItem("Developer", "Test", "Ctrl+Shift+T");

description: Removes a menu item from a menu.
name: removeMenuItem

params.description: Name of the menu to remove a menu item from.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the menu item to remove.
params.name: menuItem

examples:
<caption>Remove a menu item from the "Developer" menu.</caption>
Menu.removeMenuItem("Developer", "Test");

description: Checks whether a menu item exists.
name: menuItemExists

params.description: Name of the menu that the menu item is in.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the menu item to check for existence of.
params.name: menuItem

returns.description: true if the menu item exists, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Determine if the Developer > Stats menu exists.</caption>
if (Menu.menuItemExists("Developer", "Stats")) {
    print("Developer > Stats menu item exists.");
}

description: Checks whether a checkable menu item is checked.
name: isOptionChecked

params.description: The name of the menu item.
params.name: menuOption

returns.description: true if the option is checked, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Report whether the Settings > Developer menu item is turned on.</caption>
print("Developer menu showing: " + Menu.isOptionChecked("Developer Menu"));

description: Sets a checkable menu item as checked or unchecked.
name: setIsOptionChecked

params.description: The name of the menu item to modify.
params.name: menuOption

params.description: If true, the menu item will be checked, otherwise it will not be checked.
params.name: isChecked

examples:
<caption>Turn on Settings > Developer Menu.</caption>
Menu.setIsOptionChecked("Developer Menu", true);
print("Developer menu showing: " + Menu.isOptionChecked("Developer Menu"));

description: Triggers a menu item as if the user clicked on it.
name: triggerOption

params.description: The name of the menu item to trigger.
params.name: menuOption

examples:
<caption>Open the Asset Browser dialog.</caption>
Menu.triggerOption('Asset Browser');

description:
Checks whether a menu or menu item is enabled. If disabled, the item is grayed out and unusable.
Menus are enabled by default.
name: isMenuEnabled

params.description: The name of the menu or menu item to check.
params.name: menuName

returns.description: true if the menu is enabled, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Report whether the Settings > Developer Menu item is enabled.</caption>
print("Developer Menu item enabled: " + Menu.isMenuEnabled("Settings > Developer Menu"));

description: Sets a menu or menu item to be enabled or disabled. If disabled, the item is grayed out and unusable.
name: setMenuEnabled

params.description: The name of the menu or menu item to modify.
params.name: menuName

params.description: If true, the menu will be enabled, otherwise it will be disabled.
params.name: isEnabled

examples:
<caption>Disable the Settings > Developer Menu item.</caption>
Menu.setMenuEnabled("Settings > Developer Menu", false);
print("Developer Menu item enabled: " + Menu.isMenuEnabled("Settings > Developer Menu"));

description: Triggered when a menu item is clicked or triggered by {@link Menu.triggerOption}.
name: menuItemEvent

params.description: Name of the menu item that was clicked or triggered.
params.name: menuItem

examples:
<caption>Detect menu item events.</caption>
function onMenuItemEvent(menuItem) {
    print("Menu item clicked: " + menuItem);
}

Menu.menuItemEvent.connect(onMenuItemEvent);

The PlatformInfo API provides information about the hardware platform being used.
name: PlatformInfo

description:
The platform tier of a computer is an indication of its rendering capability.

ValueNameDescription
0UNKNOWNUnknown rendering capability.
1LOWLow-end PC, capable of rendering low-quality graphics.
2MIDBusiness-class PC, capable of rendering medium-quality graphics.
3HIGHHigh-end PC, capable of rendering high-quality graphics.
name: PlatformTier

examples:
<caption>Report details of the computer's CPUs.</caption>

    var cpuDescription = PlatformInfo.getCPU(i);

description:
The rendering method is specified by the following values:

ValueNameDescription
0DEFERREDMore complex rendering pipeline where lighting is applied to the scene as a whole after all objects have been rendered.
1FORWARDSimpler rendering pipeline where each object in the scene, in turn, is rendered and has lighting applied.

Warning: For internal, debugging purposes. Subject to change.

The Selection API provides a means of grouping together and highlighting avatars and entities in named lists.
name: Selection
examples:
<caption>Outline an entity when it is grabbed by the mouse or a controller.</caption>
// Create an entity and copy the following script into the entity's "Script URL" field.
// Move the entity behind another entity to see the occluded outline.
(function () {
    var LIST_NAME = "SelectionExample",
        ITEM_TYPE = "entity",
        HIGHLIGHT_STYLE = {
            outlineUnoccludedColor: { red: 0, green: 180, blue: 239 },
            outlineUnoccludedAlpha: 0.5,
            outlineOccludedColor: { red: 239, green: 180, blue: 0 },
            outlineOccludedAlpha: 0.5,
            outlineWidth: 4
        };

    Selection.enableListHighlight(LIST_NAME, HIGHLIGHT_STYLE);

    this.startNearGrab = function (entityID) {
        Selection.addToSelectedItemsList(LIST_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, entityID);
    };

    this.startDistanceGrab = function (entityID) {
        Selection.addToSelectedItemsList(LIST_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, entityID);
    };

    this.releaseGrab = function (entityID) {
        Selection.removeFromSelectedItemsList(LIST_NAME, ITEM_TYPE, entityID);
    };

    Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
        Selection.removeListFromMap(LIST_NAME);
    });
});

returns.description: true if the item was successfully removed or was not in the list, otherwise false.

description:
Enables highlighting for a selection list. All items in or subsequently added to the list are displayed with the highlight effect specified. The method can be called multiple times with different values in the style to modify the highlighting.

Note: This function implicitly calls {@link Selection.enableListToScene|enableListToScene}.

params.description: The name of the selection list.

params.description: The highlight style.

returns.description: true always.

Disables highlighting for a selection list.

Note: This function implicitly calls {@link Selection.disableListToScene|disableListToScene}.

returns.description: true always.

Enables scene selection for a selection list. All items in or subsequently added to the list are sent to a scene 
selection in the rendering engine for debugging purposes.

returns.description: true always.

params.description: The name of the selection list.

returns.description: true always.

The highlight style of the selection list if the list exists and highlighting is

The Settings API provides a facility to store and retrieve values that persist between Interface runs.
name: Settings

description: Retrieves the value from a named setting.
name: getValue

params.description: The name of the setting.
params.name: key

params.description: The value to return if the setting doesn't exist.
params.name: defaultValue

returns.description: The value stored in the named setting if it exists, otherwise the defaultValue.

examples:
<caption>Retrieve non-existent setting values.</caption>
var value1 = Settings.getValue("Script Example/Nonexistent Key");
print("Value: " + (typeof value1) + " " + JSON.stringify(value1));  // string ""

var value2 = Settings.getValue("Script Example/Nonexistent Key", true);
print("Value: " + (typeof value2) + " " + JSON.stringify(value2));  // boolean true

description: Stores a value in a named setting. If the setting already exists, its value is overwritten. If the value is null or undefined, the setting is deleted.
name: setValue

params.description: The name of the setting. Be sure to use a unique name if creating a new setting.
params.name: key

params.description: The value to store in the setting. If null or undefined is specified, the setting is deleted.
params.name: value

examples:
<caption>Store and retrieve an object value.</caption>
Settings.setValue("Script Example/My Key", { x: 0, y: 10, z: 0 });

var value = Settings.getValue("Script Example/My Key");
print("Value: " + (typeof value) + " " + JSON.stringify(value));  // object {"x":0,"y":10,"z":0}

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The WalletScriptingInterface API provides functions related to the user's wallet and verification of certified avatar entities.
name: WalletScriptingInterface

properties.description: The status of the user's wallet. Read-only.
properties.name: walletStatus

properties.description: true if Interface is running in limited commerce mode. In limited commerce mode, certain Interface functionalities are disabled, e.g., users can't buy items that are not free from the Marketplace. The Oculus Store and Steam versions of Interface run in limited commerce mode. Read-only.
properties.name: limitedCommerce

description: Checks and updates the user's wallet status.
name: refreshWalletStatus

description: Gets the current status of the user's wallet.
name: getWalletStatus
examples:
<caption>Use two methods to report your wallet's status.</caption>
print("Wallet status: " + WalletScriptingInterface.walletStatus);  // Same value as next line.
print("Wallet status: " + WalletScriptingInterface.getWalletStatus());

description:
Check that a certified avatar entity is owned by the avatar whose entity it is. The result of the check is provided via the {@link WalletScriptingInterface.ownershipVerificationSuccess|ownershipVerificationSuccess} and {@link WalletScriptingInterface.ownershipVerificationFailed|ownershipVerificationFailed} signals.

Warning: Neither of these signals are triggered if the entity is not an avatar entity or is not certified.
name: proveAvatarEntityOwnershipVerification

params.description: The avatar entity's ID.
params.name: entityID

examples:
<caption>Check the ownership of all nearby certified avatar entities.</caption>
// Set up response handling.
function ownershipSuccess(entityID) {
    print("Ownership test succeeded for: " + entityID);
}
function ownershipFailed(entityID) {
    print("Ownership test failed for: " + entityID);
}
WalletScriptingInterface.ownershipVerificationSuccess.connect(ownershipSuccess);
WalletScriptingInterface.ownershipVerificationFailed.connect(ownershipFailed);

// Check ownership of all nearby certified avatar entities.
var entityIDs = Entities.findEntities(MyAvatar.position, 10);
var i, length;
for (i = 0, length = entityIDs.length; i < length; i++) {
    var properties = Entities.getEntityProperties(entityIDs[i], ["entityHostType", "certificateID"]);
    if (properties.entityHostType === "avatar" && properties.certificateID !== "") {
        print("Prove ownership of: " + entityIDs[i]);
        WalletScriptingInterface.proveAvatarEntityOwnershipVerification(entityIDs[i]);
    }
}

// Tidy up.
Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    WalletScriptingInterface.ownershipVerificationFailed.disconnect(ownershipFailed);
    WalletScriptingInterface.ownershipVerificationSuccess.disconnect(ownershipSuccess);
});

description: Triggered when the user's wallet status changes.
name: walletStatusChanged
examples:
<caption>Report when your wallet status changes, e.g., when you log in and out.</caption>
WalletScriptingInterface.walletStatusChanged.connect(function () {
    print("Wallet status changed to: " + WalletScriptingInterface.walletStatus");
});

description: Triggered when the user's limited commerce status changes.
name: limitedCommerceChanged

description:
Triggered when the user rezzes a certified entity but the user's wallet is not ready. So the certified location of the
entity cannot be updated in the metaverse.
name: walletNotSetup

description:
Triggered when a certified avatar entity's ownership check requested via 
{@link WalletScriptingInterface.proveAvatarEntityOwnershipVerification|proveAvatarEntityOwnershipVerification} succeeds.
name: ownershipVerificationSuccess

params.description: The ID of the avatar entity checked.
params.name: entityID

description:
Triggered when a certified avatar entity's ownership check requested via
{@link WalletScriptingInterface.proveAvatarEntityOwnershipVerification|proveAvatarEntityOwnershipVerification} fails.
name: ownershipVerificationFailed

params.description: The ID of the avatar entity checked.
params.name: entityID

description:
The buttons that may be included in a message box created by {@link Window.openMessageBox|openMessageBox} are defined by numeric values:
Button Value Description
NoButton 0x0 An invalid button.
Ok 0x400 "OK"
Save 0x800 "Save"
SaveAll 0x1000 "Save All"
Open 0x2000 "Open"
Yes 0x4000 "Yes"
YesToAll 0x8000 "Yes to All"
No 0x10000 "No"
NoToAll 0x20000 "No to All"
Abort 0x40000 "Abort"
Retry 0x80000 "Retry"
Ignore 0x100000 "Ignore"
Close 0x200000 "Close"
Cancel 0x400000 "Cancel"
Discard 0x800000 "Discard" or "Don't Save"
Help 0x1000000 "Help"
Apply 0x2000000 "Apply"
Reset 0x4000000 "Reset"
RestoreDefaults 0x8000000 "Restore Defaults"
name: MessageBoxButton

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Window API provides various facilities not covered elsewhere, including: window dimensions, window focus, camera view, announcements, user connections, common dialog boxes, snapshots, file import, domain navigation, domain changes, domain physics, OS clipboard, build number.
name: Window

properties.description: The width of the drawable area of the Interface window (i.e., without borders or other chrome), in pixels. Read-only.
properties.name: innerWidth

properties.description: The height of the drawable area of the Interface window (i.e., without borders or other chrome), in pixels. Read-only.
properties.name: innerHeight

properties.description: The x display coordinate of the top left corner of the drawable area of the Interface window. Read-only.
properties.name: x

properties.description: The y display coordinate of the top left corner of the drawable area of the Interface window. Read-only.
properties.name: y

properties.description: true if the interstitial graphics are displayed when a domain is loading, otherwise false.
properties.name: interstitialModeEnabled

properties.description: Provides facilities for working with your current metaverse location.
properties.name: location

description: Checks whether the Interface window has focus.
name: hasFocus

returns.description: true if the Interface window has focus, false if it doesn't.

description:
Makes the Interface window have focus. On Windows, if Interface doesn't already have focus, the task bar icon flashes to 
indicate that Interface wants attention but focus isn't taken away from the application that the user is using.
name: setFocus

description: Raises the Interface window if it is minimized. If raised, the window gains focus.
name: raise

description:
Displays a dialog with the specified message and an "OK" button. The dialog is non-modal; the script continues without
waiting for a user response.
name: alert

params.description: The message to display.
params.name: message

examples:
<caption>Display a friendly greeting.</caption>
Window.alert("Welcome!");
print("Script continues without waiting");

description: Prompts the user to confirm something. Displays a modal dialog with a message plus "Yes" and "No" buttons.
name: confirm

params.description: The question to display.
params.name: message

returns.description: true if the user selects "Yes", otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Ask the user a question requiring a yes/no answer.</caption>
var answer = Window.confirm("Are you sure?");
print(answer);  // true or false

description:
Prompts the user to enter some text. Displays a modal dialog with a message and a text box, plus "OK" and "Cancel" 
buttons.
name: prompt

params.description: The question to display.
params.name: message

params.description: The default answer text.
params.name: defaultText

returns.description: The text that the user entered if they select "OK", otherwise "".

examples:
<caption>Ask the user a question requiring a text answer.</caption>
var answer = Window.prompt("Question", "answer");
if (answer === "") {
    print("User canceled");
} else {
    print("User answer: " + answer);
}

description:
Prompts the user to enter some text. Displays a non-modal dialog with a message and a text box, plus "OK" and "Cancel" 
buttons. A {@link Window.promptTextChanged|promptTextChanged} signal is emitted when the user OKs the dialog; no signal 
is emitted if the user cancels the dialog.
name: promptAsync

params.description: The question to display.
params.name: message

params.description: The default answer text.
params.name: defaultText

examples:
<caption>Ask the user a question requiring a text answer without waiting for the answer.</caption>
function onPromptTextChanged(text) {
    print("User answer: " + text);
}
Window.promptTextChanged.connect(onPromptTextChanged);

Window.promptAsync("Question", "answer");
print("Script continues without waiting");

description: Prompts the user to choose a directory. Displays a modal dialog that navigates the directory tree.

params.description: The title to display at the top of the dialog.
params.name: title

params.description: The initial directory to start browsing at.
params.name: directory

returns.description: The path of the directory if one is chosen, otherwise null.

examples:
<caption>Ask the user to choose a directory.</caption>

print("Directory: " + directory);

description:
Prompts the user to choose a directory. Displays a non-modal dialog that navigates the directory tree. A
{@link Window.browseDirChanged|browseDirChanged} signal is emitted when a directory is chosen; no signal is emitted if
the user cancels the dialog.

params.description: The title to display at the top of the dialog.

params.description: The initial directory to start browsing at.

description: Gets Interface's build number.

params.name: text

description:
Takes a snapshot of the current Interface view from the primary camera. When a still image only is captured, {@link Window.stillSnapshotTaken|stillSnapshotTaken} is emitted; when a still image plus moving images are captured, {@link Window.processingGifStarted|processingGifStarted} and {@link Window.processingGifCompleted|processingGifCompleted} are emitted.

Snapshots are saved to the path specified in Settings > General > Snapshots, which can be accessed via the {@link Snapshot} API.
name: takeSnapshot

params.description:
This value is passed on through the {@link Window.stillSnapshotTaken|stillSnapshotTaken}
    signal.
params.name: notify

params.description: If true, a moving image is captured as an animated GIF in addition to a still image.
params.name: includeAnimated

params.description: The width/height ratio of the snapshot required. If the value is 0, the full resolution is used (window dimensions in desktop mode; HMD display dimensions in HMD mode), otherwise one of the dimensions is adjusted in order to match the aspect ratio.
params.name: aspectRatio

params.description:
If a filename is not provided, the image is saved as "hifi-snap-by-<user name>-on-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS".

Still images are saved in JPEG or PNG format according to the extension provided — ".jpg", ".jpeg", or ".png" — or if not provided then in JPEG format with an extension of ".jpg". Animated images are saved in GIF format.
params.name: filename

examples:
<caption>Using the snapshot function and signals.</caption>
function onStillSnapshotTaken(path, notify) {
    print("Still snapshot taken: " + path);
    print("Notify: " + notify);
}

function onProcessingGifStarted(stillPath) {
    print("Still snapshot taken: " + stillPath);
}

function onProcessingGifCompleted(animatedPath) {
    print("Animated snapshot taken: " + animatedPath);
}

Window.stillSnapshotTaken.connect(onStillSnapshotTaken);
Window.processingGifStarted.connect(onProcessingGifStarted);
Window.processingGifCompleted.connect(onProcessingGifCompleted);

var notify = true;
var animated = true;
var aspect = 1920 / 1080;
var filename = "example-snapshot";
Window.takeSnapshot(notify, animated, aspect, filename);

description:
Takes a still snapshot of the current view from the secondary camera that can be set up through the {@link Render} API.

Snapshots are saved to the path specified in Settings > General > Snapshots, which can be accessed via the {@link Snapshot} API.
name: takeSecondaryCameraSnapshot

params.description:
This value is passed on through the {@link Window.stillSnapshotTaken|stillSnapshotTaken}
    signal.
params.name: notify

params.description:
If a filename is not provided, the image is saved as "hifi-snap-by-<user name>-on-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS".

Images are saved in JPEG or PNG format according to the extension provided — ".jpg", ".jpeg", or ".png" — or if not provided then in JPEG format with an extension of ".jpg".
params.name: filename

description:
Takes a 360° snapshot at a given position for the secondary camera. The secondary camera does not need to have been set up.

Snapshots are saved to the path specified in Settings > General > Snapshots, which can be accessed via the {@link Snapshot} API.
name: takeSecondaryCamera360Snapshot

params.description: The position of the camera for the snapshot.
params.name: cameraPosition

params.description: If true then the snapshot is saved as a cube map image, otherwise it is saved as an equirectangular image.
params.name: cubemapOutputFormat

params.description:
This value is passed on through the {@link Window.stillSnapshotTaken|stillSnapshotTaken}
    signal.
params.name: notify

params.description:
If a filename is not provided, the image is saved as "hifi-snap-by-<user name>-on-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS".

Images are saved in JPEG or PNG format according to the extension provided — ".jpg", ".jpeg", or ".png" — or if not provided then in JPEG format with an extension of ".jpg".
params.name: filename

description:
Emits a {@link Window.connectionAdded|connectionAdded} or a {@link Window.connectionError|connectionError} signal that
indicates whether or not a user connection was successfully made using the Web API.

params.description: If true then {@link Window.connectionAdded|connectionAdded} is emitted, otherwise {@link Window.connectionError|connectionError} is emitted.

params.description: Descriptive text about the connection success or error. This is sent in the signal emitted.
params.name: description

description:
Displays a notification message. Notifications are displayed in panels by the default script, nofications.js. An
{@link Window.announcement|announcement} signal is emitted when this function is called.
name: displayAnnouncement

params.description: The announcement message.

examples:
<caption>Send and capture an announcement message.</caption>

    // The message is also displayed as a notification by notifications.js.
    print("Announcement: " + message);
}
Window.announcement.connect(onAnnouncement);

description:
Prepares a snapshot ready for sharing. A {@link Window.snapshotShared|snapshotShared} signal is emitted when the snapshot
has been prepared.

params.name: path

params.description: The metaverse location where the snapshot was taken.
params.name: href

description:
Checks to see if physics is active for you in the domain you're visiting - there is a delay between your arrival at a
domain and physics becoming active for you in that domain.
name: isPhysicsEnabled

returns.description: true if physics is currently active for you, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Wait for physics to be enabled when you change domains.</caption>
function checkForPhysics() {
    var isPhysicsEnabled = Window.isPhysicsEnabled();
    print("Physics enabled: " + isPhysicsEnabled);
    if (!isPhysicsEnabled) {
        Script.setTimeout(checkForPhysics, 1000);
    }
}

function onDomainChanged(domain) {
    print("Domain changed: " + domain);
    Script.setTimeout(checkForPhysics, 1000);
}

Window.domainChanged.connect(onDomainChanged);

description:

returns.description: true if the display texture was successfully set, otherwise false.

returns.description: The width and height of the Interface window or HMD rendering surface, in pixels.

description: Gets the last domain connection error when a connection is refused.

description:
Opens a non-modal message box that can have a variety of button combinations. See also, 
{@link Window.updateMessageBox|updateMessageBox} and {@link Window.closeMessageBox|closeMessageBox}.
name: openMessageBox

params.description: The title to display for the message box.
params.name: title

params.description: Text to display in the message box.
params.name: text

params.description:
The buttons to display on the message box; one or more button values added
    together.
params.name: buttons

params.description: The button that has focus when the message box is opened.
params.name: defaultButton

returns.description: The ID of the message box created.

examples:
<caption>Ask the user whether that want to reset something.</caption>
var messageBox;
var resetButton = 0x4000000;
var cancelButton = 0x400000;

function onMessageBoxClosed(id, button) {
    if (id === messageBox) {
        if (button === resetButton) {
            print("Reset");
        } else {
            print("Don't reset");
        }
    }
}
Window.messageBoxClosed.connect(onMessageBoxClosed);

messageBox = Window.openMessageBox("Reset Something", 
    "Do you want to reset something?",
    resetButton + cancelButton, cancelButton);

description:
Opens a URL in the Interface window or other application, depending on the URL's scheme. The following schemes are supported:
  • hifi: Navigate to the URL in Interface.
  • hifiapp: Open a system app in Interface.

Other schemes will either be handled by the OS (e.g. http, https, or mailto) or will display a dialog asking the user to confirm that they want to try to open the URL.
name: openUrl

params.description: The URL to open.
params.name: url

params.description: If true, the user is automatically returned back to the scene when the activity is completed.

The buttons to display on the message box; one or more button values added
    together.

params.description: The button that has focus when the message box is opened.
params.name: defaultButton

name: closeMessageBox

params.description: The ID of the message box.

description: A set of properties used when creating an InteractiveWindow.
name: Properties

properties.description: The title of the window.
properties.name: title

properties.description: The initial position of the window, in pixels.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The initial size of the window, in pixels
properties.name: size

properties.description: true to make the window visible when created, false to make it invisible.
properties.name: visible

properties.description: Desktop.PresentationMode.VIRTUAL to display the window inside Interface, .NATIVE to display it as its own separate window.
properties.name: presentationMode

properties.description: Controls how a NATIVE window is displayed. If used, the window is docked to the specified edge of the Interface window, otherwise the window is displayed as its own separate window.
properties.name: presentationWindowInfo

properties.description:
Window behavior flags in addition to "native window flags" (minimize/maximize/close),
    set at window creation. Possible flag values are provided as {@link Desktop|Desktop.ALWAYS_ON_TOP} and {@link Desktop|Desktop.CLOSE_BUTTON_HIDES}.
    Additional flag values can be found on Qt's website at https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qt.html#WindowType-enum.
properties.name: additionalFlags

properties.description:
Window behavior flags instead of the default window flags.
    Set at window creation. Possible flag values are provided as {@link Desktop|Desktop.ALWAYS_ON_TOP} and {@link Desktop|Desktop.CLOSE_BUTTON_HIDES}.
    Additional flag values can be found on Qt's website at https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qt.html#WindowType-enum.
properties.name: overrideFlags

description: Configures how a NATIVE window is displayed.
name: PresentationWindowInfo

properties.description: The edge of the Interface window to dock to.
properties.name: dockArea

description:
A set of flags controlling InteractiveWindow behavior. The value is constructed by using the | (bitwise OR) operator on the individual flag values.

Flag NameValueDescription
ALWAYS_ON_TOP1The window always displays on top.
CLOSE_BUTTON_HIDES2The window hides instead of closing when the user clicks the "close" button.
name: Flags

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

An InteractiveWindow can display either inside Interface or in its own window separate from the Interface window. The window content is defined by a QML file, which can optionally include a WebView control that embeds an HTML web page. (The WebView control is defined by a "WebView.qml" file included in the Interface install.)

Create using {@link Desktop.createWindow}.
name: InteractiveWindow

properties.description: The title of the window.
properties.name: title

properties.description: The position of the window, in pixels.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The size of the window, in pixels.
properties.name: size

properties.description: true if the window is visible, false if it isn't.
properties.name: visible

properties.description: The presentation mode of the window: Desktop.PresentationMode.VIRTUAL to display the window inside Interface, .NATIVE to display it as its own separate window.
properties.name: presentationMode

name: sendToQml

params.description: The message to send to the QML page.
params.name: message

examples:
<caption>Send and receive messages with a QML window.</caption>
// JavaScript file.

var qmlWindow = Desktop.createWindow(Script.resolvePath("QMLWindow.qml"), {
    title: "QML Window",
    size: { x: 400, y: 300 }
});

qmlWindow.fromQml.connect(function (message) {
    print("Message received: " + message);
});

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    qmlWindow.sendToQml("Hello world!");
}, 2000);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    qmlWindow.close();
});

name: emitScriptEvent

params.description: The message to send to the embedded HTML web page.
params.name: message

params.description: The message.
params.name: message

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Snapshot API provides access to the path that snapshots are saved to. This path is that provided in Settings > General > Snapshots. Snapshots may be taken using Window API functions such as {@link Window.takeSnapshot}.
name: Snapshot

description: Triggered when the path that snapshots are saved to is changed.
name: snapshotLocationSet

params.description: The new snapshots location.
params.name: location

examples:
<caption>Report when the snapshots location is changed.</caption>
// Run this script then change the snapshots location in Settings > General > Snapshots.
Snapshot.snapshotLocationSet.connect(function (path) {
    print("New snapshot location: " + path);
});

description: Gets the path that snapshots are saved to.
name: getSnapshotsLocation

returns.description: The path to save snapshots to.

description: Sets the path that snapshots are saved to.
name: setSnapshotsLocation

params.description: The path to save snapshots to.
params.name: location

description:
An overlay may be one of the following types:

Value2D/3DDescriptionProperties
"rectangle"2D A rectangle. {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Rectangle|OverlayProperties-Rectangle}
"image"2D An image. {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Image|OverlayProperties-Image}
"text"2D Some text. {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Text|OverlayProperties-Text}
"cube"3D

A cube. A "shape" overlay can also be used to create a cube.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Cube|OverlayProperties-Cube}
"sphere"3D

A sphere. A "shape" overlay can also be used to create a sphere.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Sphere|OverlayProperties-Sphere}
"shape"3D

A geometric shape, such as a cube, sphere, or cylinder.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Shape|OverlayProperties-Shape}
"model"3D

A model.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Model|OverlayProperties-Model}
"image3d"3D

An image. Synonym: "billboard".

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Image3D|OverlayProperties-Image3D}
"rectangle3d"3D

A rectangle.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Rectangle3D|OverlayProperties-Rectangle3D}
"text3d"3D

Some text.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Text3D|OverlayProperties-Text3D}
"web3d"3D

Web content.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Web3D|OverlayProperties-Web3D}
"line3d"3D

A line.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Line3D|OverlayProperties-Line3D}
"grid"3D

A grid of lines in a plane.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Grid|OverlayProperties-Grid}
"circle3d"3D

A circle.

Deprecated.

 {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties-Circle3D|OverlayProperties-Circle3D}

2D overlays are rendered on the display surface in desktop mode and on the HUD surface in HMD mode. 3D overlays are rendered at a position and orientation in-world.

3D overlays are deprecated. Use local {@link Entities} instead.
name: OverlayType

description:
Different overlay types have different properties: some common to all overlays (listed in the table) and some specific to each {@link Overlays.OverlayType|OverlayType} (linked to below).

3D overlays are local entities, internally, so they also support the relevant entity's properties.
name: OverlayProperties

properties.description: The ID of the overlay. Read-only.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The overlay's type. Read-only.
properties.name: type

properties.description: true if the overlay is rendered, false if it isn't.
properties.name: visible

description: The "image" {@link Overlays.OverlayType|OverlayType} is for 2D images. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties|OverlayProperties}.
name: OverlayProperties-Image

properties.description: The position and size of the image display area, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: bounds

properties.description: Integer left, x-coordinate value of the image display area = bounds.x. Write-only.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Integer top, y-coordinate value of the image display area = bounds.y. Write-only.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Integer width of the image display area = bounds.width. Write-only.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Integer height of the image display area = bounds.height. Write-only.
properties.name: height

properties.description: The URL of the image file to display. The image is scaled to fit to the bounds. Write-only.
properties.name: imageURL

properties.description: The portion of the image to use. If not specified, the whole image is used. Write-only.
properties.name: subImage

properties.description: The color to apply over the top of the image to colorize it. Write-only.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The opacity of the color applied over the top of the image, 0.0 – 1.0. Write-only.
properties.name: alpha

description: The "text" {@link Overlays.OverlayType|OverlayType} is for 2D text. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties|OverlayProperties}.
name: OverlayProperties-Text

properties.description: The position and size of the rectangle, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: bounds

properties.description: Integer left, x-coordinate value = bounds.x. Write-only.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Integer top, y-coordinate value = bounds.y. Write-only.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Integer width of the rectangle = bounds.width. Write-only.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Integer height of the rectangle = bounds.height. Write-only.
properties.name: height

properties.description: The leftMargin and topMargin values, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: margin

properties.description: The left margin's size, in pixels. This value is also used for the right margin. Write-only.
properties.name: leftMargin

properties.description: The top margin's size, in pixels. This value is also used for the bottom margin. Write-only.
properties.name: topMargin

properties.description: The text to display. Text does not automatically wrap; use "\n" for a line break. Text is clipped to the bounds. Write-only.
properties.name: text

properties.description: The size of the text, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: font.size

properties.description: The height of a line of text, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: lineHeight

properties.description: The color of the text. Synonym: textColor. Write-only.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The opacity of the overlay, 0.0 – 1.0. Write-only.
properties.name: alpha

properties.description: The color of the background rectangle. Write-only.
properties.name: backgroundColor

properties.description: The opacity of the background rectangle, 0.0 – 1.0. Write-only.
properties.name: backgroundAlpha

description: The "rectangle" {@link Overlays.OverlayType|OverlayType} is for 2D rectangles. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties|OverlayProperties}.
name: OverlayProperties-Rectangle

properties.description: The position and size of the rectangle, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: bounds

properties.description: Integer left, x-coordinate value = bounds.x. Write-only.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Integer top, y-coordinate value = bounds.y. Write-only.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Integer width of the rectangle = bounds.width. Write-only.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Integer height of the rectangle = bounds.height. Write-only.
properties.name: height

properties.description: Integer corner radius, in pixels. Write-only.
properties.name: radius

properties.description: The color of the overlay. Write-only.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The opacity of the overlay, 0.0 – 1.0. Write-only.
properties.name: alpha

properties.description: Integer width of the border, in pixels. The border is drawn within the rectangle's bounds. It is not drawn unless either borderColor or borderAlpha are specified. Write-only.
properties.name: borderWidth

properties.description: The color of the border. Write-only.
properties.name: borderColor

properties.description: The opacity of the border, 0.0 – 1.0. Write-only.
properties.name: borderAlpha

description:
The "cube" {@link Overlays.OverlayType|OverlayType} is for 3D cubes. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Overlays.OverlayProperties|OverlayProperties}. It additionally has properties per the {@link Entities.EntityProperties-Box|Box} entity.

Deprecated: Use local {@link Entities} instead.
name: OverlayProperties-Cube

properties.description: The name of the overlay.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The color of the overlay.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The opacity of the overlay, 0.0 – 1.0.
properties.name: alpha

properties.description: The maximum value of the pulse multiplier.
properties.name: pulseMax

properties.description: The minimum value of the pulse multiplier.
properties.name: pulseMin

properties.description: The duration of the color and alpha pulse, in seconds. A pulse multiplier value goes from pulseMin to pulseMax, then pulseMax to pulseMin in one period.
properties.name: pulsePeriod

properties.description:
If non-zero, the alpha of the overlay is pulsed: the alpha value is multiplied by the
    current pulse multiplier value each frame. If > 0 the pulse multiplier is applied in phase with the pulse period; if < 0
    the pulse multiplier is applied out of phase with the pulse period. (The magnitude of the property isn't otherwise
    used.)
properties.name: alphaPulse

properties.description:
If non-zero, the color of the overlay is pulsed: the color value is multiplied by the
    current pulse multiplier value each frame. If > 0 the pulse multiplier is applied in phase with the pulse period; if < 0
    the pulse multiplier is applied out of phase with the pulse period. (The magnitude of the property isn't otherwise
    used.)
properties.name: colorPulse

properties.description: The position of the overlay center. Synonyms: p1, point, and start.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The dimensions of the overlay. Synonyms: scale, size.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description: The orientation of the overlay. Synonym: orientation.
properties.name: rotation

properties.description: The local position of the overlay relative to its parent if the overlay has a parentID set, otherwise the same value as position.
properties.name: localPosition

properties.description: The orientation of the overlay relative to its parent if the overlay has a parentID set, otherwise the same value as rotation. Synonym: localOrientation.
properties.name: localRotation

properties.description: true if the overlay is rendered as a solid, false if it is rendered as a wire frame. Synonyms: solid, isFilled, and filled. Antonyms: isWire and wire.
properties.name: isSolid

properties.description: true if {@link Picks} ignore the overlay, false if they don't. Synonym: ignoreRayIntersection.
properties.name: ignorePickIntersection

properties.description: true if the overlay is rendered on top of the world layer but behind the HUD surface.
properties.name: drawInFront

properties.description: true if the overlay is rendered in front of everything, including the HUD surface.
properties.name: drawHUDLayer

properties.description: true if the overlay can be grabbed, false if it can't be.
properties.name: grabbable

properties.description: The avatar, entity, or overlay that the overlay is parented to.
properties.name: parentID

properties.description: Integer value specifying the joint of the entity or avatar that the entity is parented to if parentID is set. Use 65535 or -1 to parent to the parent's position and orientation rather than a joint.
properties.name: parentJointIndex

description:
A "shape" {@link Overlays.OverlayType|OverlayType} may display as one of the following geometrical shapes:

ValueDimensionsDescription
"Circle"2DA circle oriented in 3D.
"Cone"3D
"Cube"3D
"Cylinder"3D
"Dodecahedron"3D
"Hexagon"3DA hexagonal prism.
"Icosahedron"3D
"Octagon"3DAn octagonal prism.
"Octahedron"3D
"Quad"2DA square oriented in 3D.
"Sphere"3D
"Tetrahedron"3D
"Torus"3DNot implemented.
"Triangle"3DA triangular prism.
name: Shape
