name: Standard

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

A {@link Controller} mapping object that can contain a set of routes that map:

  • {@link Controller.Standard} outputs to {@link Controller.Actions} actions or script functions.
  • {@link Controller.Hardware} outputs to {@link Controller.Standard} outputs, {@link Controller.Actions} actions, or script functions.

Create by one of the following methods:

  • Use {@link Controller.newMapping} to create the mapping object, add routes using {@link MappingObject#from|from} or {@link MappingObject#makeAxis|makeAxis}, and map the routes to actions or functions using {@link RouteObject} methods.
  • Use {@link Controller.parseMapping} or {@link Controller.loadMapping} to load a {@link Controller.MappingJSON}.

Enable the mapping using {@link MappingObject#enable|enable} or {@link Controller.enableMapping} for it to take effect.

Mappings and their routes are applied according to the following rules:

  • One read per output: after a controller output has been read, it can't be read again. Exception: You can use {@link RouteObject#peek} to read a value without marking that output as having been read.
  • Existing mapping routes take precedence over new mapping routes: within a mapping, if a route is added for a control output that already has a route the new route is ignored.
  • New mappings override previous mappings: each output is processed using the route in the most recently enabled mapping that contains that output.
name: MappingObject

description: A {@link MappingObject} can be specified in JSON format. A simple example is provided below. Full examples — the default mappings provided in Interface — can be found at https://github.com/highfidelity/hifi/tree/master/interface/resources/controllers.
name: MappingJSON

properties.description: The name of the mapping.
properties.name: name

properties.description: An array of routes.
properties.name: channels

examples:
<caption>A simple mapping JSON that makes the right trigger move your avatar up after a dead zone.</caption>
{
    "name": "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.jsonMapping",
    "channels": [
        { 
            "from": "Standard.RT", 
            "filters": { "type": "deadZone", "min": 0.05 },
            "to": "Actions.TranslateY"
        }
    ]
}

description: A route in a {@link Controller.MappingJSON}.
name: MappingJSONRoute

properties.description: The name of a {@link Controller.Hardware} property or an axis made from them. If a property name, the leading "Controller.Hardware." can be omitted.
properties.name: from

properties.description: If true, then peeking is enabled per {@link RouteObject#peek}.
properties.name: peek

properties.description: If true, then debug is enabled per {@link RouteObject#debug}.
properties.name: debug

properties.description: One or more numeric {@link Controller.Hardware} property names which are evaluated as booleans and ANDed together. Prepend a property name with a ! to do a logical NOT. The leading "Controller.Hardware." can be omitted from the property names.
properties.name: when

properties.description: One or more filters in the route.
properties.name: filters

properties.description: The name of a {@link Controller.Actions} or {@link Controller.Standard} property. The leading "Controller." can be omitted.
properties.name: to

description: An axis pair in a {@link Controller.MappingJSONRoute}.
name: MappingJSONAxis

properties.description: A two-member array of single-member arrays of {@link Controller.Hardware} property names. The leading "Controller.Hardware." can be omitted from the property names.
properties.name: makeAxis

examples:
<caption>An axis using the keyboard's left and right keys.</caption>
{ "makeAxis" : [
        ["Keyboard.Left"],
        ["Keyboard.Right"]
    ]
}

description: A filter in a {@link Controller.MappingJSONRoute}.
name: MappingJSONFilter

properties.description: The name of the filter, being the name of the one of the {@link RouteObject}'s filter methods.
properties.name: type

properties.description:
If the filter method has a first parameter, the property name is the name of that parameter and the 
    property value is the value to use.

If the filter method has a second parameter, the property name  is the name of that parameter and 
    the property value is the value to use.

examples:
<caption>A hysteresis filter.</caption>
{ 
    "type": "hysteresis", 
    "min": 0.85, 
    "max": 0.9
}

description:
Creates a new {@link RouteObject} from a controller output, ready to be mapped to a standard control, action, or function.

This is a QML-specific version of {@link MappingObject#from|from}: use this version in QML files.
name: fromQml

params.description:
The controller output or function that is the source
    of the route data. If a function, it must return a number or a {@link Pose} value as the route data.
params.name: source

returns.description: A route ready for mapping to an action or function using {@link RouteObject} methods.

description:
Creates a new {@link RouteObject} from two numeric {@link Controller.Hardware} outputs, one applied in the negative direction and the other in the positive direction, ready to be mapped to a standard control, action, or function.

This is a QML-specific version of {@link MappingObject#makeAxis|makeAxis}: use this version in QML files.
name: makeAxisQml

params.description: The first, negative-direction controller output.
params.name: source1

params.description: The second, positive-direction controller output.
params.name: source2

returns.description: A route ready for mapping to an action or function using {@link RouteObject} methods. The data value passed to the route is the combined value of source2 - source1.

description:
Creates a new {@link RouteObject} from a controller output, ready to be mapped to a standard control, action, or 
function.
name: from

params.description:
The controller output or function that is the source 
    of the route data. If a function, it must return a number or a {@link Pose} value as the route data.
params.name: source

returns.description: A route ready for mapping to an action or function using {@link RouteObject} methods.

description:
Creates a new {@link RouteObject} from two numeric {@link Controller.Hardware} outputs, one applied in the negative 
direction and the other in the positive direction, ready to be mapped to a standard control, action, or function.
name: makeAxis

params.description: The first, negative-direction controller output.
params.name: source1

params.description: The second, positive-direction controller output.
params.name: source2

returns.description: A route ready for mapping to an action or function using {@link RouteObject} methods. The data value passed to the route is the combined value of source2 - source1.

examples:
<caption>Make the Oculus Touch triggers move your avatar up and down.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping
    .makeAxis(Controller.Hardware.OculusTouch.LT, Controller.Hardware.OculusTouch.RT)
    .to(Controller.Actions.Up);
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description:
Enables or disables the mapping. When enabled, the routes in the mapping take effect.

Synonymous with {@link Controller.enableMapping}.
name: enable

params.description: If true then the mapping is enabled, otherwise it is disabled.
params.name: enable

returns.description: The mapping object, so that further routes can be added.

description:
Disables the mapping. When disabled, the routes in the mapping have no effect.

Synonymous with {@link Controller.disableMapping}.
name: disable

returns.description: The mapping object, so that further routes can be added.

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

A route in a {@link MappingObject} used by the {@link Controller} API.

Create a route using {@link MappingObject} methods and apply this object's methods to process it, terminating with {@link RouteObject#to} to apply it to a Standard control, action, or script function. Note: Loops are not permitted.

Some methods apply to routes with number data, some apply routes with {@link Pose} data, and some apply to both route types.
name: RouteObject

description:
Terminates the route with a standard control, an action, or a script function. The output value from the route is sent to the specified destination.

This is a QML-specific version of {@link MappingObject#to|to}: use this version in QML files.
name: toQml

params.description:
The standard control, action, or JavaScript
function that the route output is mapped to. For a function, the parameter can be either the name of the function or
an in-line function definition.
params.name: destination

description:
Processes the route only if a condition is satisfied. The condition is evaluated before the route input is read, and the input is read only if the condition is true. Thus, if the condition is not met then subsequent routes using the same input are processed.

This is a QML-specific version of {@link MappingObject#when|when}: use this version in QML files.
name: whenQml

params.description:
A condition may be a:

  • A boolean or numeric {@link Controller.Hardware} property, which is evaluated as a boolean.
  • ! followed by a {@link Controller.Hardware} property, indicating the logical NOT should be used.
  • A script function returning a boolean value. This can be either the name of the function or an in-line definition.

If an array of conditions is provided, their values are ANDed together.
params.name: expression

returns.description: The RouteObject with the condition added.

description:
Terminates the route with a standard control, an action, or a script function. The output value from the route is 
sent to the specified destination.
name: to

params.description:
The standard control, action, or JavaScript 
function that the route output is mapped to. For a function, the parameter can be either the name of the function or 
an in-line function definition.
params.name: destination

examples:
<caption>Make the right trigger move your avatar up.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT).to(Controller.Actions.TranslateY);
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

<caption>Make the right trigger call a function.</caption>
function onRightTrigger(value) {
    print("Trigger value: " + value);
}

var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT).to(onRightTrigger);
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Enables or disables writing debug information for a route to the program log.
name: debug

params.description: If true then writing debug information is enabled for the route, otherwise it is disabled.
params.name: enable

returns.description: The RouteObject with debug output enabled or disabled.

examples:
<caption>Write debug information to the program log for a right trigger mapping.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT).debug().to(function (value) {
    print("Value: " + value);
});

// Information similar to the following is written each frame:
[DEBUG] [hifi.controllers] Beginning mapping frame
[DEBUG] [hifi.controllers] Processing device routes
[DEBUG] [hifi.controllers] Processing standard routes
[DEBUG] [hifi.controllers] Applying route  ""
[DEBUG] [hifi.controllers] Value was  5.96046e-07
[DEBUG] [hifi.controllers] Filtered value was  5.96046e-07

Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description:
Processes the route without marking the controller output as having been read, so that other routes from the same 
controller output can also process.
name: peek

params.description: If true then the route is processed without marking the route's controller source as having been read.
params.name: enable

returns.description: The RouteObject with the peek feature enabled.

description: Processes the route only if a condition is satisfied. The condition is evaluated before the route input is read, and the input is read only if the condition is true. Thus, if the condition is not met then subsequent routes using the same input are processed.
name: when

params.description:
A condition may be a:

  • A numeric {@link Controller.Hardware} property, which is evaluated as a boolean.
  • ! followed by a {@link Controller.Hardware} property to use the logical NOT of the property value.
  • A script function returning a boolean value. This can be either the name of the function or an in-line definition.

If an array of conditions is provided, their values are ANDed together.

Warning: The use of ! is not currently supported in JavaScript .when() calls.
params.name: expression

returns.description: The RouteObject with the condition added.

examples:
<caption>Process the right trigger differently in HMD and desktop modes.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

// Processed only if in HMD mode.
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT)
    .when(Controller.Hardware.Application.InHMD)
    .to(function () { print("Trigger pressed in HMD mode."); });

// Processed only if previous route not processed.
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT)
    .to(function () { print("Trigger pressed in desktop mode."); });

Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description:
Filters numeric route values to lie between two values; values outside this range are not passed on through the 
route.
name: clamp

params.description: The minimum value to pass through.
params.name: min

params.description: The maximum value to pass through.
params.name: max

returns.description: The route object with the clamp filter added.

examples:
<caption>Clamp right trigger values to between 0.3 and 0.7.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT).clamp(0.3, 0.7).to(function (value) {
    print("Value: " + value);
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Filters numeric route values such that they are rounded to 0 or 1 without output values flickering when the input value hovers around 0.5. For example, this enables you to use an analog input as if it were a toggle.
name: hysteresis

params.description: When the input value drops below this value the output value changes to 0.
params.name: min

params.description: When the input value rises above this value the output value changes to 1.
params.name: max

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples:
<caption>Round the right joystick forward/back values to 0 or 1 with hysteresis.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).peek().to(function (value) {
    print("Raw value: " + value);  // 0.0 - 1.0.
});
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).hysteresis(0.3, 0.7).to(function (value) {
    print("Hysteresis value: " + value);  // 0 or 1.
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Filters numeric route values to send at a specified interval.
name: pulse

params.description: The interval between sending values, in seconds.
params.name: interval

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples:
<caption>Send right trigger values every half second.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RT).pulse(0.5).to(function (value) {
    print("Value: " + value);
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Filters numeric and {@link Pose} route values to be scaled by a constant amount.
name: scale

params.description: The scale to multiply the value by.
params.name: multiplier

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples:
<caption>Scale the value of the right joystick forward/back values by 10.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.LY).to(function (value) {
    print("L value: " + value);  // -1.0 to 1.0 values.
});
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).scale(10.0).to(function (value) {
    print("R value: " + value);  // -10.0 to -10.0 values.
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Filters numeric and {@link Pose} route values to have the opposite sign, e.g., 0.5 is changed to -0.5.
name: invert

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples:
<caption>Invert the value of the right joystick forward/back values.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.LY).to(function (value) {
    print("L value: " + value);  // -1.0 to 1.0 values, forward to back.
});
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).invert().to(function (value) {
    print("R value: " + value);  // 1.0 to -1.0 values, forward to back.
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Filters numeric route values such that they're sent only when the input value is outside a dead-zone. When the input passes the dead-zone value, output is sent starting at 0.0 and catching up with the input value. As the input returns toward the dead-zone value, output values reduce to 0.0 at the dead-zone value.
name: deadZone

params.description:
The minimum input value at which to start sending output. For negative input values, the 
   negative of this value is used.
params.name: min

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples:
<caption>Apply a dead-zone to the right joystick forward/back values.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).deadZone(0.2).to(function (value) {
    print("Value: " + value);  // 0.0 - 1.0 values once outside the dead-zone.
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Filters numeric route values such that they are rounded to -1, 0, or 1. For example, this enables you to use an analog input as if it were a toggle or, in the case of a bidirectional axis, a tri-state switch.
name: constrainToInteger

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples: Round the right joystick forward/back values to -1, 0, or 1. var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping"; var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME); mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).constrainToInteger().to(function (value) { print("Value: " + value); // -1, 0, or 1 }); Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME); Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () { Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME); });

description: Filters numeric route values such that they are rounded to 0 or 1. For example, this enables you to use an analog input as if it were a toggle.
name: constrainToPositiveInteger

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples: Round the right joystick forward/back values to 0 or 1. var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping"; var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME); mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RY).constrainToPositiveInteger().to(function (value) { print("Value: " + value); // 0, or 1 }); Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME); Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () { Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME); });

description: Filters {@link Pose} route values to have a pre-translation applied.
name: translate

params.description: The pre-translation to add to the pose.
params.name: translate

returns.description: The RouteObject with the pre-translation applied.

description: Filters {@link Pose} route values to have a pre-transform applied.
name: transform

params.description: The pre-transform to apply.
params.name: transform

returns.description: The RouteObject with the pre-transform applied.

description: Filters {@link Pose} route values to have a post-transform applied.
name: postTransform

params.description: The post-transform to apply.
params.name: transform

returns.description: The RouteObject with the post-transform applied.

description: Filters {@link Pose} route values to have a pre-rotation applied.
name: rotate

params.description: The pre-rotation to add to the pose.
params.name: rotation

returns.description: The RouteObject with the pre-rotation applied.

description: Filters {@link Pose} route values to be smoothed by a low velocity filter. The filter's rotation and translation values are calculated as: (1 - f) * currentValue + f * previousValue where f = currentVelocity / filterConstant. At low velocities, the filter value is largely the previous value; at high velocities the value is wholly the current controller value.
name: lowVelocity

params.description:
The rotational velocity, in rad/s, at which the filter value is wholly the latest 
    controller value.
params.name: rotationConstant

params.description:
The linear velocity, in m/s, at which the filter value is wholly the latest 
    controller value.
params.name: translationConstant

returns.description: The RouteObject smoothed by low velocity filtering.

description: Filters {@link Pose} route values to be smoothed by an exponential decay filter. The filter's rotation and translation values are calculated as: filterConstant * currentValue + (1 - filterConstant) * previousValue. Values near 1 are less smooth with lower latency; values near 0 are more smooth with higher latency.
name: exponentialSmoothing

params.description: Rotation filter constant, 0.0–1.0.
params.name: rotationConstant

params.description: Translation filter constant, 0.0–1.0.
params.name: translationConstant

returns.description: The RouteObject smoothed by an exponential filter.

description: Filters numeric route values such that a value of 0.0 is changed to 1.0, and other values are changed to 0.0.
name: logicalNot

returns.description: The RouteObject with the filter applied.

examples:
<caption>Logical NOT of LSTouch value.</caption>
var MAPPING_NAME = "com.highfidelity.controllers.example.newMapping";
var mapping = Controller.newMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RSTouch).peek().to(function (value) {
    print("RSTouch: " + value);
});
mapping.from(Controller.Standard.RSTouch).logicalNot().to(function (value) {
    print("localNot of RSTouch: " + value);
});
Controller.enableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Controller.disableMapping(MAPPING_NAME);
});

description: Triggered when the HMD.ipdScale property value changes.
name: IPDScaleChanged

description: Triggered when Interface's display mode changes and when the user puts on or takes off their HMD.
name: displayModeChanged

params.description: true if the display mode is HMD, otherwise false. This is the same value as provided by HMD.active.
params.name: isHMDMode

examples:
<caption>Report when the display mode changes.</caption>
HMD.displayModeChanged.connect(function (isHMDMode) {
    print("Display mode changed");
    print("isHMD = " + isHMDMode);
    print("HMD.active = " + HMD.active);
    print("HMD.mounted = " + HMD.mounted);
});

description: Triggered when the HMD.mounted property value changes.
name: mountedChanged
examples:
<caption>Report when there's a change in the HMD being worn.</caption>
HMD.mountedChanged.connect(function () {
    print("Mounted changed. HMD is mounted: " + HMD.mounted);
});

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

The Reticle API provides access to the mouse cursor. The cursor may be an arrow or a reticle circle, depending on Interface settings. The mouse cursor is visible in HMD mode if controllers aren't being used.
name: Reticle

properties.description: true if the mouse cursor will be captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content (excluding menus) has focus, false if the mouse cursor will not be captured.
properties.name: allowMouseCapture

properties.description: The depth (distance) that the reticle is displayed at relative to the HMD view, in HMD mode.
properties.name: depth

properties.description: The maximum reticle coordinates on the display device in desktop mode or the HUD surface in HMD mode. (The minimum reticle coordinates on the desktop display device or HUD surface are 0, 0.) Read-only.
properties.name: maximumPosition

properties.description: true if the mouse cursor is captured, displaying only in Interface and not on the rest of the desktop. The mouse cursor may be captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content (excluding menu items) has focus, if capturing is enabled (allowMouseCapture is true). Read-only.
properties.name: mouseCaptured

properties.description: true if the mouse cursor is pointing at UI in the Interface window in desktop mode or on the HUD surface in HMD mode, false if it isn't. Read-only.
properties.name: pointingAtSystemOverlay

properties.description:
The position of the cursor. This is the position relative to the Interface window in desktop mode, and the HUD surface in HMD mode.

Note: The position values may be negative.
properties.name: position

properties.description:
The scale of the reticle circle in desktop mode, and the arrow and reticle circle in HMD mode. 
    (Does not affect the size of the arrow in desktop mode.)
properties.name: scale

properties.description: true if the reticle circle is visible in desktop mode, and the arrow or reticle circle are visible in HMD mode; false otherwise. (Does not affect the visibility of the mouse pointer in desktop mode.)
properties.name: visible

description: Checks whether the mouse cursor is captured, displaying only in Interface and not on the rest of the desktop. The mouse cursor is captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content (excluding menu items) has focus, if capturing is enabled (allowMouseCapture property value is true).
name: isMouseCaptured

returns.description: true if the mouse cursor is captured, displaying only in Interface and not on the desktop.

description:
Gets whether the mouse cursor will be captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content (excluding menu items) 
has focus. When captured, the mouse cursor displays only in Interface, not on the rest of the desktop.
name: getAllowMouseCapture

returns.description: true if the mouse cursor will be captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content has focus, false if the mouse cursor will not be captured.

description:
Sets whether the mouse cursor will be captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content (excluding menu items)
has focus. When captured, the mouse cursor displays only in Interface, not on the rest of desktop.
name: setAllowMouseCapture

params.description: true if the mouse cursor will be captured when in HMD mode and the Interface window content has focus, false if the mouse cursor will not be captured.
params.name: allowMouseCaptured

description:
Gets whether the mouse cursor is pointing at UI in the Interface window in desktop mode or on the HUD surface in HMD 
mode.
name: isPointingAtSystemOverlay

returns.description: true if the mouse cursor is pointing at UI in the Interface window in desktop mode or on the HUD surface in HMD mode, false if it isn't.

description: Gets whether the reticle circle is visible in desktop mode, or the arrow or reticle circle are visible in HMD mode.
name: getVisible

returns.description: true if the reticle circle is visible in desktop mode, and the arrow or reticle circle are visible in HMD mode; false otherwise. (The mouse pointer is always visible in desktop mode.)

description: Sets whether the reticle circle is visible in desktop mode, or the arrow or reticle circle are visible in HMD mode.
name: setVisible

params.description: true if the reticle circle is visible in desktop mode, and the arrow or reticle circle are visible in HMD mode; false otherwise. (Does not affect the visibility of the mouse pointer in desktop mode.)
params.name: visible

description: Gets the depth (distance) that the reticle is displayed at relative to the HMD view, in HMD mode.
name: getDepth

returns.description: The depth (distance) that the reticle is displayed at relative to the HMD view, in HMD mode.

description: Sets the depth (distance) that the reticle is displayed at relative to the HMD view, in HMD mode.
name: setDepth

params.description: The depth (distance) that the reticle is displayed at relative to the HMD view, in HMD mode.
params.name: depth

description: Gets the scale of the reticle circle in desktop mode, and the arrow and reticle circle in HMD mode. (Does not affect the size of the arrow in desktop mode.) The default scale is 1.0.
name: getScale

returns.description: The scale of the reticle.

description: Sets the scale of the reticle circle in desktop mode, and the arrow and reticle circle in HMD mode. (Does not affect the size of the arrow in desktop mode.) The default scale is 1.0.
name: setScale

params.description: The scale of the reticle.
params.name: scale

description:
Gets the position of the cursor. This is the position relative to the Interface window in desktop mode, and the HUD surface in HMD mode.

Note: The position values may be negative.
name: getPosition

returns.description: The position of the cursor.

description:
Sets the position of the cursor. This is the position relative to the Interface window in desktop mode, and the HUD surface in HMD mode.

Note: The position values may be negative.
name: setPosition

params.description: The position of the cursor.
params.name: position

description: Gets the maximum reticle coordinates on the display device in desktop mode or the HUD surface in HMD mode. (The minimum reticle coordinates on the desktop display device or HUD surface are 0, 0.)
name: getMaximumPosition

returns.description: The maximum reticle coordinates on the display device in desktop mode or the HUD surface in HMD mode.

description: Ambient light is defined by the following properties:
name: AmbientLight

properties.description: The intensity of the light.
properties.name: ambientIntensity

properties.description: A cube map image that defines the color of the light coming from each direction. If "" then the entity's {@link Entities.Skybox|Skybox} url property value is used, unless that also is "" in which case the entity's ambientLightMode property is set to "inherit".
properties.name: ambientURL

description: An animation is configured by the following properties:
name: AnimationProperties

properties.description:
The URL of the glTF or FBX file that has the animation. glTF files may be in JSON or binary format (".gltf" or ".glb" URLs respectively).

Warning: glTF animations currently do not always animate correctly.
properties.name: url

properties.description: true to enable translations contained in the animation to be played, false to disable translations.
properties.name: allowTranslation

properties.description: The speed in frames/s that the animation is played at.
properties.name: fps

properties.description: The first frame to play in the animation.
properties.name: firstFrame

properties.description: The last frame to play in the animation.
properties.name: lastFrame

properties.description: The current frame being played in the animation.
properties.name: currentFrame

properties.description: true if the animation should play, false if it shouldn't.
properties.name: running

properties.description: true if the animation is continuously repeated in a loop, false if it isn't.
properties.name: loop

properties.description: true if the rotations and translations of the last frame played are maintained when the animation stops playing, false if they aren't.
properties.name: hold

description: Bloom is defined by the following properties:
name: Bloom

properties.description: The intensity of the bloom effect.
properties.name: bloomIntensity

properties.description: The threshold for the bloom effect.
properties.name: bloomThreshold

properties.description: The size of the bloom effect.
properties.name: bloomSize

description:
An entity action may be one of the following types:

ValueTypeDescriptionArguments
"far-grab"Avatar action Moves and rotates an entity to a target position and orientation, optionally relative to another entity. Collisions between the entity and the user's avatar are disabled during the far-grab. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-FarGrab}
"hold"Avatar action Positions and rotates an entity relative to an avatar's hand. Collisions between the entity and the user's avatar are disabled during the hold. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-Hold}
"offset"Object action Moves an entity so that it is a defined distance away from a target point. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-Offset}
"tractor"Object action Moves and rotates an entity to a target position and orientation, optionally relative to another entity. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-Tractor}
"travel-oriented"Object action Orients an entity to align with its direction of travel. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-TravelOriented}
"hinge"Object constraint Lets an entity pivot about an axis or connects two entities with a hinge joint. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-Hinge}
"slider"Object constraint Lets an entity slide and rotate along an axis, or connects two entities that slide and rotate along a shared axis. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-Slider|ActionArguments-Slider}
"cone-twist"Object constraint Connects two entities with a joint that can move through a cone and can twist. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-ConeTwist}
"ball-socket"Object constraint Connects two entities with a ball and socket joint. {@link Entities.ActionArguments-BallSocket}
"spring" Synonym for "tractor".

Deprecated.
name: ActionType

description:
Different entity types have different properties: some common to all entities (listed in the table) and some specific to 
each {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} (linked to below).
name: EntityProperties

properties.description: The ID of the entity. Read-only.
properties.name: id

properties.description: A name for the entity. Need not be unique.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The entity's type. You cannot change the type of an entity after it's created. However, its value may switch among "Box", "Shape", and "Sphere" depending on changes to the shape property set for entities of these types. Read-only.
properties.name: type

properties.description: How the entity is hosted and sent to others for display. The value can only be set at entity creation by one of the {@link Entities.addEntity} methods. Read-only.
properties.name: entityHostType

properties.description: true if the entity is an {@link Entities.EntityHostType|avatar entity}, false if it isn't. The value is per the entityHostType property value, set at entity creation by one of the {@link Entities.addEntity} methods. Read-only.
properties.name: avatarEntity

properties.description: A synonym for avatarEntity. Read-only.
properties.name: clientOnly

properties.description: true if the entity is a {@link Entities.EntityHostType|local entity}, false if it isn't. The value is per the entityHostType property value, set at entity creation by one of the {@link Entities.addEntity} methods. Read-only.
properties.name: localEntity

properties.description: The session ID of the owning avatar if avatarEntity is true, otherwise {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL}. Read-only.
properties.name: owningAvatarID

properties.description: The UTC date and time that the entity was created, in ISO 8601 format as yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ. Read-only.
properties.name: created

properties.description: The age of the entity in seconds since it was created. Read-only.
properties.name: age

properties.description: The age of the entity since it was created, formatted as h hours m minutes s seconds.
properties.name: ageAsText

properties.description: How long an entity lives for, in seconds, before being automatically deleted. A value of -1 means that the entity lives for ever.
properties.name: lifetime

properties.description: When the entity was last edited, expressed as the number of microseconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC. Read-only.
properties.name: lastEdited

properties.description: The session ID of the avatar or agent that most recently created or edited the entity. Read-only.
properties.name: lastEditedBy

properties.description: true if properties other than locked cannot be changed and the entity cannot be deleted, false if all properties can be changed and the entity can be deleted.
properties.name: locked

properties.description: true if the entity is rendered, false if it isn't.
properties.name: visible

properties.description: true if the entity can cast a shadow, false if it can't. Currently applicable only to {@link Entities.EntityProperties-Model|Model} and {@link Entities.EntityProperties-Shape|Shape} entities. Shadows are cast if inside a {@link Entities.EntityProperties-Zone|Zone} entity with castShadows enabled in its keyLight property.
properties.name: canCastShadow

properties.description: true if the entity is rendered in the secondary camera, false if it isn't.
properties.name: isVisibleInSecondaryCamera

properties.description: The layer that the entity renders in.
properties.name: renderLayer

properties.description: How the entity's geometry is rendered.
properties.name: primitiveMode

properties.description: true if {@link Picks} and {@link RayPick} ignore the entity, false if they don't.
properties.name: ignorePickIntersection

properties.description: The position of the entity in world coordinates.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The orientation of the entity in world coordinates.
properties.name: rotation

properties.description:
The point in the entity that is set to the entity's position and is rotated 
     about, range {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO} – {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ONE}. A value of {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO} is the 
     entity's minimum x, y, z corner; a value of {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ONE} is the entity's maximum x, y, z corner.
properties.name: registrationPoint

properties.description: The center of the entity's unscaled mesh model if it has one, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}. Read-only.
properties.name: naturalPosition

properties.description: The dimensions of the entity's unscaled mesh model if it has one, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ONE}. Read-only.
properties.name: naturalDimensions

properties.description: The linear velocity of the entity in m/s with respect to world coordinates.
properties.name: velocity

properties.description: How much the linear velocity of an entity slows down over time, range 0.0 – 1.0. A higher damping value slows down the entity more quickly. The default value is for an exponential decay timescale of 2.0s, where it takes 2.0s for the movement to slow to 1/e = 0.368 of its initial value.
properties.name: damping

properties.description:
The angular velocity of the entity in rad/s with respect to its axes, about its
    registration point.
properties.name: angularVelocity

properties.description: How much the angular velocity of an entity slows down over time, range 0.0 – 1.0. A higher damping value slows down the entity more quickly. The default value is for an exponential decay timescale of 2.0s, where it takes 2.0s for the movement to slow to 1/e = 0.368 of its initial value.
properties.name: angularDamping

properties.description:
The acceleration due to gravity in m/s2 that the entity should move with, in world coordinates. Use a value of { x: 0, y: -9.8, z: 0 } to simulate Earth's gravity. Gravity is applied to an entity's motion only if its dynamic property is true.

If changing an entity's gravity from {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}, you need to give it a small velocity in order to kick off physics simulation.
properties.name: gravity

properties.description:
The current, measured acceleration of the entity, in m/s2.

Deprecated: This property is deprecated and will be removed.
properties.name: acceleration

properties.description: The "bounciness" of an entity when it collides, range 0.0 – 0.99. The higher the value, the more bouncy.
properties.name: restitution

properties.description: How much an entity slows down when it's moving against another, range 0.0 – 10.0. The higher the value, the more quickly it slows down. Examples: 0.1 for ice, 0.9 for sandpaper.
properties.name: friction
density

properties.description: true if the entity shouldn't collide, false if it collides with items per its collisionMask property.
properties.name: collisionless

properties.description: Synonym for collisionless.
properties.name: ignoreForCollisions

properties.description: What types of items the entity should collide with.
properties.name: collisionMask

properties.description: Synonym for collisionMask, in text format.
properties.name: collidesWith

properties.description:
The sound that's played when the entity experiences a collision. Valid file 
    formats are per {@link SoundObject}.
properties.name: collisionSoundURL

properties.description: true if the entity's movement is affected by collisions, false if it isn't.
properties.name: dynamic

properties.description: A synonym for dynamic.
properties.name: collisionsWillMove

properties.description: A "hifi://" metaverse address that a user is teleported to when they click on the entity.
properties.name: href

properties.description: A description of the href property value.
properties.name: description

properties.description:
Used to store extra data about the entity in JSON format.

Warning: Other apps may also use this property, so make sure you handle data stored by other apps: edit only your bit and leave the rest of the data intact. You can use JSON.parse() to parse the string into a JavaScript object which you can manipulate the properties of, and use JSON.stringify() to convert the object into a string to put back in the property.
properties.name: userData

properties.description: Like userData, but only accessible by server entity scripts, assignment client scripts, and users who have "Can Get and Set Private User Data" permissions in the domain.
properties.name: privateUserData

properties.description: The URL of the client entity script, if any, that is attached to the entity.
properties.name: script

properties.description: Used to indicate when the client entity script was loaded. Should be an integer number of milliseconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970 (e.g., as supplied by Date.now(). If you update the property's value, the script is re-downloaded and reloaded. This is how the "reload" button beside the "script URL" field in properties tab of the Create app works.
properties.name: scriptTimestamp

properties.description: The URL of the server entity script, if any, that is attached to the entity.
properties.name: serverScripts

properties.description:
The ID of the entity or avatar that the entity is parented to. A value of 
    {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} is used if the entity is not parented.
properties.name: parentID

properties.description: The joint of the entity or avatar that the entity is parented to. Use 65535 or -1 to parent to the entity or avatar's position and orientation rather than a joint.
properties.name: parentJointIndex

properties.description: The position of the entity relative to its parent if the entity is parented, otherwise the same value as position. If the entity is parented to an avatar and is an avatar entity so that it scales with the avatar, this value remains the original local position value while the avatar scale changes.
properties.name: localPosition

properties.description: The rotation of the entity relative to its parent if the entity is parented, otherwise the same value as rotation.
properties.name: localRotation

properties.description: The velocity of the entity relative to its parent if the entity is parented, otherwise the same value as velocity.
properties.name: localVelocity

properties.description: The angular velocity of the entity relative to its parent if the entity is parented, otherwise the same value as angularVelocity.
properties.name: localAngularVelocity

properties.description:
The dimensions of the entity. If the entity is parented to an avatar and is an
    avatar entity so that it scales with the avatar, this value remains the original dimensions value while the 
    avatar scale changes.
properties.name: localDimensions

properties.description: The axis-aligned bounding box that tightly encloses the entity. Read-only.
properties.name: boundingBox

properties.description:
The axis-aligned cube that determines where the entity lives in the entity server's octree. 
    The cube may be considerably larger than the entity in some situations, e.g., when the entity is grabbed by an avatar: 
    the position of the entity is determined through avatar mixer updates and so the AA cube is expanded in order to reduce 
    unnecessary entity server updates. Scripts should not change this property's value.
properties.name: queryAACube

properties.description: Base-64 encoded compressed dump of the actions associated with the entity. This property is typically not used in scripts directly; rather, functions that manipulate an entity's actions update it, e.g., {@link Entities.addAction}. The size of this property increases with the number of actions. Because this property value has to fit within a High Fidelity datagram packet, there is a limit to the number of actions that an entity can have; edits which would result in overflow are rejected. Read-only.
properties.name: actionData

properties.description: Information on the cost of rendering the entity. Currently information is only provided for Model entities. Read-only.
properties.name: renderInfo

properties.description: true if the domain or avatar entity can be cloned via {@link Entities.cloneEntity}, false if it can't be.
properties.name: cloneable

properties.description: The entity lifetime for clones created from this entity.
properties.name: cloneLifetime

properties.description: The total number of clones of this entity that can exist in the domain at any given time.
properties.name: cloneLimit

properties.description: true if clones created from this entity will have their dynamic property set to true, false if they won't.
properties.name: cloneDynamic

properties.description: true if clones created from this entity will be created as avatar entities, false if they won't be.
properties.name: cloneAvatarEntity

properties.description: The ID of the entity that this entity was cloned from.
properties.name: cloneOriginID

properties.description: The entity's grab-related properties.
properties.name: grab

properties.description: Certifiable name of the Marketplace item.
properties.name: itemName

properties.description: Certifiable description of the Marketplace item.
properties.name: itemDescription

properties.description: Certifiable category of the Marketplace item.
properties.name: itemCategories

properties.description: Certifiable artist that created the Marketplace item.
properties.name: itemArtist

properties.description: Certifiable license URL for the Marketplace item.
properties.name: itemLicense

properties.description:
Certifiable maximum integer number of editions (copies) of the Marketplace item 
    allowed to be sold.
properties.name: limitedRun

properties.description:
Certifiable integer edition (copy) number or the Marketplace item. Each copy sold in 
    the Marketplace is numbered sequentially, starting at 1.
properties.name: editionNumber

properties.description:
Certifiable integer instance number for identical entities in a Marketplace 
    item. A Marketplace item may have multiple, identical parts. If so, then each is numbered sequentially with an instance 
    number.
properties.name: entityInstanceNumber

properties.description:
Certifiable UUID for the Marketplace item, as used in the URL of the item's download
    and its Marketplace Web page.
properties.name: marketplaceID

properties.description: Hash of the entity's static certificate JSON, signed by the artist's private key.
properties.name: certificateID

properties.description: The version of the method used to generate the certificateID.
properties.name: staticCertificateVersion

tags.title: comment
tags.text: The different entity types have additional properties as follows:
tags.value: The different entity types have additional properties as follows:

description: The "Box" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} is the same as the "Shape" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} except that its shape value is always set to "Cube" when the entity is created. If its shape property value is subsequently changed then the entity's type will be reported as "Sphere" if the shape is set to "Sphere", otherwise it will be reported as "Shape".
name: EntityProperties-Box

description: The "Light" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} adds local lighting effects. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}.
name: EntityProperties-Light

properties.description:
The dimensions of the entity. Surfaces outside these dimensions are not lit 
    by the light.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description: The color of the light emitted.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The brightness of the light.
properties.name: intensity

properties.description: The distance from the light's center at which intensity is reduced by 25%.
properties.name: falloffRadius

properties.description: true if the light is directional, emitting along the entity's local negative z-axis; false if the light is a point light which emanates in all directions.
properties.name: isSpotlight

properties.description: Affects the softness of the spotlight beam: the higher the value the softer the beam.
properties.name: exponent

properties.description: Affects the size of the spotlight beam: the higher the value the larger the beam.
properties.name: cutoff

examples:
<caption>Create a spotlight pointing at the ground.</caption>
Entities.addEntity({
    type: "Light",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0.5, z: -4 })),
    rotation: Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(-75, 0, 0),
    dimensions: { x: 5, y: 5, z: 5 },
    intensity: 100,
    falloffRadius: 0.3,
    isSpotlight: true,
    exponent: 20,
    cutoff: 30,
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

description:
The "Line" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} draws thin, straight lines between a sequence of two or more points. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}.

Deprecated: Use {@link Entities.EntityProperties-PolyLine|PolyLine} entities instead.
name: EntityProperties-Line

properties.description: The dimensions of the entity. Must be sufficient to contain all the linePoints.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description: The sequence of points to draw lines between. The values are relative to the entity's position. A maximum of 70 points can be specified. The property's value is set only if all the linePoints lie within the entity's dimensions.
properties.name: linePoints

properties.description: The color of the line.
properties.name: color

examples:
<caption>Draw lines in a "V".</caption>
var entity = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "Line",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0.75, z: -5 })),
    rotation: MyAvatar.orientation,
    dimensions: { x: 2, y: 2, z: 1 },
    linePoints: [
        { x: -1, y: 1, z: 0 },
        { x: 0, y: -1, z: 0 },
        { x: 1, y: 1, z: 0 },
    ],
    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 },
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

description:
The "Material" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} modifies existing materials on entities and avatars. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}.

To apply a material to an entity, set the material entity's parentID property to the entity ID. To apply a material to an avatar, set the material entity's parentID property to the avatar's session UUID. To apply a material to your avatar such that it persists across domains and log-ins, create the material as an avatar entity by setting the entityHostType parameter in {@link Entities.addEntity} to "avatar" and set the entity's parentID property to MyAvatar.SELF_ID. Material entities render as non-scalable spheres if they don't have their parent set.
name: EntityProperties-Material

properties.description: Used when materialMappingMode == "projected".
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description: URL to a {@link Entities.MaterialResource|MaterialResource}. If you append "#name" to the URL, the material with that name in the {@link Entities.MaterialResource|MaterialResource} will be applied to the entity. Alternatively, set the property value to "materialData" to use the materialData property for the {@link Entities.MaterialResource|MaterialResource} values.
properties.name: materialURL

properties.description: Used to store {@link Entities.MaterialResource|MaterialResource} data as a JSON string. You can use JSON.parse() to parse the string into a JavaScript object which you can manipulate the properties of, and use JSON.stringify() to convert the object into a string to put in the property.
properties.name: materialData

properties.description: The priority for applying the material to its parent. Only the highest priority material is applied, with materials of the same priority randomly assigned. Materials that come with the model have a priority of 0.
properties.name: priority

properties.description:
Selects the mesh part or parts within the parent to which to apply the material. If in the format "mat::string", all mesh parts with material name "string" are replaced. If "all", then all mesh parts are replaced. Otherwise the property value is parsed as an unsigned integer, specifying the mesh part index to modify.

If the string represents an array (starts with "[" and ends with "]"), the string is split at each "," and each element parsed as either a number or a string if it starts with "mat::". For example, "[0,1,mat::string,mat::string2]" will replace mesh parts 0 and 1, and any mesh parts with material "string" or "string2". Do not put spaces around the commas. Invalid values are parsed to 0.
properties.name: parentMaterialName

properties.description: How the material is mapped to the entity. Either "uv" or "projected". In "uv" mode, the material is evaluated within the UV space of the mesh it is applied to. In "projected" mode, the 3D transform (position, rotation, and dimensions) of the Material entity is used to evaluate the texture coordinates for the material.
properties.name: materialMappingMode

properties.description: Offset position in UV-space of the top left of the material, range { x: 0, y: 0 } – { x: 1, y: 1 }.
properties.name: materialMappingPos

properties.description: How much to scale the material within the parent's UV-space.
properties.name: materialMappingScale

properties.description: How much to rotate the material within the parent's UV-space, in degrees.
properties.name: materialMappingRot

properties.description: true if the material repeats, false if it doesn't. If false, fragments outside of texCoord 0 – 1 will be discarded. Works in both "uv" and "projected" modes.
properties.name: materialRepeat

examples:
<caption>Color a sphere using a Material entity.</caption>
var entityID = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "Sphere",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0, z: -5 })),
    dimensions: { x: 1, y: 1, z: 1 },
    color: { red: 128, green: 128, blue: 128 },
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

var materialID = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "Material",
    parentID: entityID,
    materialURL: "materialData",
    priority: 1,
    materialData: JSON.stringify({
        materialVersion: 1,
        materials: {
            // Value overrides entity's "color" property.
            albedo: [1.0, 1.0, 0]  // Yellow
        }
    })
});

description: The "Model" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} displays a glTF, FBX, or OBJ model. When adding an entity, if no dimensions value is specified then the model is automatically sized to its {@link Entities.EntityProperties|naturalDimensions}. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}.
name: EntityProperties-Model

properties.description: The dimensions of the entity. When adding an entity, if no dimensions value is specified then the model is automatically sized to its {@link Entities.EntityProperties|naturalDimensions}.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description:
The URL of the glTF, FBX, or OBJ model. glTF models may be in JSON or binary format 
    (".gltf" or ".glb" URLs respectively). Baked models' URLs have ".baked" before the file type. Model files may also be 
    compressed in GZ format, in which case the URL ends in ".gz".
properties.name: modelURL

properties.description:
The scale factor applied to the model's dimensions.

Deprecated: This property is deprecated and will be removed.
properties.name: modelScale

properties.description: A JSON string of texture name, URL pairs used when rendering the model in place of the model's original textures. Use a texture name from the originalTextures property to override that texture. Only the texture names and URLs to be overridden need be specified; original textures are used where there are no overrides. You can use JSON.stringify() to convert a JavaScript object of name, URL pairs into a JSON string.
properties.name: textures

properties.description: A JSON string of texture name, URL pairs used in the model. The property value is filled in after the entity has finished rezzing (i.e., textures have loaded). You can use JSON.parse() to parse the JSON string into a JavaScript object of name, URL pairs. Read-only.
properties.name: originalTextures

properties.description: Currently not used.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The shape of the collision hull used if collisions are enabled.
properties.name: shapeType

properties.description: The model file to use for the compound shape if shapeType is "compound".
properties.name: compoundShapeURL

properties.description: An animation to play on the model.
properties.name: animation

properties.description:
Joint rotations applied to the model; [] if none are applied or the model hasn't loaded. The array indexes are per {@link Entities.getJointIndex|getJointIndex}. Rotations are relative to each joint's parent.

Joint rotations can be set by {@link Entities.setLocalJointRotation|setLocalJointRotation} and similar functions, or by setting the value of this property. If you set a joint rotation using this property, you also need to set the corresponding jointRotationsSet value to true.
properties.name: jointRotations

properties.description: true values for joints that have had rotations applied, false otherwise; [] if none are applied or the model hasn't loaded. The array indexes are per {@link Entities.getJointIndex|getJointIndex}.
properties.name: jointRotationsSet

properties.description:
Joint translations applied to the model; [] if none are applied or the model hasn't loaded. The array indexes are per {@link Entities.getJointIndex|getJointIndex}. Translations are relative to each joint's parent.

Joint translations can be set by {@link Entities.setLocalJointTranslation|setLocalJointTranslation} and similar functions, or by setting the value of this property. If you set a joint translation using this property you also need to set the corresponding jointTranslationsSet value to true.
properties.name: jointTranslations

properties.description: true values for joints that have had translations applied, false otherwise; [] if none are applied or the model hasn't loaded. The array indexes are per {@link Entities.getJointIndex|getJointIndex}.
properties.name: jointTranslationsSet

properties.description: true if when the entity is parented to an avatar, the avatar's joint rotations are applied to the entity's joints; false if a parent avatar's joint rotations are not applied to the entity's joints.
properties.name: relayParentJoints

properties.description: true if the mesh parts of the model are LOD culled as a group, false if separate mesh parts are LOD culled individually.
properties.name: groupCulled

examples:
<caption>Rez a Vive tracker puck.</caption>
var entity = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "Model",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0.75, z: -2 })),
    rotation: MyAvatar.orientation,
    modelURL: "http://content.highfidelity.com/seefo/production/puck-attach/vive_tracker_puck.obj",
    dimensions: { x: 0.0945, y: 0.0921, z: 0.0423 },
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

description: The "ParticleEffect" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} displays a particle system that can be used to simulate things such as fire, smoke, snow, magic spells, etc. The particles emanate from an ellipsoid or part thereof. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}.
name: EntityProperties-ParticleEffect

properties.description: true if particles are being emitted, false if they aren't.
properties.name: isEmitting

properties.description:
The maximum number of particles to render at one time. Older particles are deleted if 
    necessary when new ones are created.
properties.name: maxParticles

properties.description: How long, in seconds, each particle lives.
properties.name: lifespan

properties.description: The number of particles per second to emit.
properties.name: emitRate

properties.description: The speed, in m/s, that each particle is emitted at.
properties.name: emitSpeed

properties.description: The spread in speeds at which particles are emitted at. For example, if emitSpeed == 5 and speedSpread == 1, particles will be emitted with speeds in the range 4 – 6m/s.
properties.name: speedSpread

properties.description:
The acceleration that is applied to each particle during its lifetime. The 
    default is Earth's gravity value.
properties.name: emitAcceleration

properties.description: The spread in accelerations that each particle is given. For example, if emitAccelerations == {x: 0, y: -9.8, z: 0} and accelerationSpread == {x: 0, y: 1, z: 0}, each particle will have an acceleration in the range {x: 0, y: -10.8, z: 0} – {x: 0, y: -8.8, z: 0}.
properties.name: accelerationSpread

properties.description: The dimensions of the particle effect, i.e., a bounding box containing all the particles during their lifetimes, assuming that emitterShouldTrail == false. Read-only.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description: true if particles are "left behind" as the emitter moves, false if they stay within the entity's dimensions.
properties.name: emitterShouldTrail

properties.description: The orientation of particle emission relative to the entity's axes. By default, particles emit along the entity's local z-axis, and azimuthStart and azimuthFinish are relative to the entity's local x-axis. The default value is a rotation of -90 degrees about the local x-axis, i.e., the particles emit vertically.
properties.name: emitOrientation

properties.description: The shape from which particles are emitted.
properties.name: shapeType

properties.description: The model file to use for the compound shape if shapeType == "compound".
properties.name: compoundShapeURL

properties.description: The dimensions of the shape from which particles are emitted.
properties.name: emitDimensions

properties.description: The starting radius within the shape at which particles start being emitted; range 0.0 – 1.0 for the center to the surface, respectively. Particles are emitted from the portion of the shape that lies between emitRadiusStart and the shape's surface.
properties.name: emitRadiusStart

properties.description: The angle in radians from the entity's local z-axis at which particles start being emitted within the shape; range 0 – Math.PI. Particles are emitted from the portion of the shape that lies between polarStart and polarFinish. Only used if shapeType is "ellipsoid" or "sphere".
properties.name: polarStart

properties.description: The angle in radians from the entity's local z-axis at which particles stop being emitted within the shape; range 0 – Math.PI. Particles are emitted from the portion of the shape that lies between polarStart and polarFinish. Only used if shapeType is "ellipsoid" or "sphere".
properties.name: polarFinish

properties.description: The angle in radians from the entity's local x-axis about the entity's local z-axis at which particles start being emitted; range -Math.PI – Math.PI. Particles are emitted from the portion of the shape that lies between azimuthStart and azimuthFinish. Only used if shapeType is "ellipsoid", "sphere", or "circle".
properties.name: azimuthStart

properties.description: The angle in radians from the entity's local x-axis about the entity's local z-axis at which particles stop being emitted; range -Math.PI – Math.PI. Particles are emitted from the portion of the shape that lies between azimuthStart and azimuthFinish. Only used if shapeType is "ellipsoid", "sphere", or "circle".
properties.name: azimuthFinish

properties.description:
The URL of a JPG or PNG image file to display for each particle. If you want transparency,
    use PNG format.
properties.name: textures

properties.description: The radius of each particle at the middle of its life.
properties.name: particleRadius

properties.description: The radius of each particle at the start of its life. If null, the particleRadius value is used.
properties.name: radiusStart

properties.description: The radius of each particle at the end of its life. If null, the particleRadius value is used.
properties.name: radiusFinish

properties.description: The spread in radius that each particle is given. For example, if particleRadius == 0.5 and radiusSpread == 0.25, each particle will have a radius in the range 0.25 – 0.75.
properties.name: radiusSpread

properties.description: The color of each particle at the middle of its life.
properties.name: color

properties.description: The color of each particle at the start of its life. If any of the component values are undefined, the color value is used.
properties.name: colorStart

properties.description: The color of each particle at the end of its life. If any of the component values are undefined, the color value is used.
properties.name: colorFinish

properties.description: The spread in color that each particle is given. For example, if color == {red: 100, green: 100, blue: 100} and colorSpread == {red: 10, green: 25, blue: 50}, each particle will have a color in the range {red: 90, green: 75, blue: 50} – {red: 110, green: 125, blue: 150}.
properties.name: colorSpread

properties.description: The opacity of each particle at the middle of its life.
properties.name: alpha

properties.description: The opacity of each particle at the start of its life. If null, the alpha value is used.
properties.name: alphaStart

properties.description: The opacity of each particle at the end of its life. If null, the alpha value is used.
properties.name: alphaFinish

properties.description: The spread in alpha that each particle is given. For example, if alpha == 0.5 and alphaSpread == 0.25, each particle will have an alpha in the range 0.25 – 0.75.
properties.name: alphaSpread

properties.description:
Color and alpha pulse.

Deprecated: This property is deprecated and will be removed.
properties.name: pulse

properties.description: The rotation of each particle at the middle of its life, range -2 * Math.PI – 2 * Math.PI radians.
properties.name: particleSpin

properties.description: The rotation of each particle at the start of its life, range -2 * Math.PI – 2 * Math.PI radians. If null, the particleSpin value is used.
properties.name: spinStart

properties.description: The rotation of each particle at the end of its life, range -2 * Math.PI – 2 * Math.PI radians. If null, the particleSpin value is used.
properties.name: spinFinish
spinSpread

properties.description: true if the particles' rotations are relative to the entity's instantaneous rotation, false if they're relative to world coordinates. If true with particleSpin == 0, the particles keep oriented per the entity's orientation.
properties.name: rotateWithEntity

examples:
<caption>Create a ball of green smoke.</caption>
particles = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "ParticleEffect",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0.5, z: -4 })),
    lifespan: 5,
    emitRate: 10,
    emitSpeed: 0.02,
    speedSpread: 0.01,
    emitAcceleration: { x: 0, y: 0.02, z: 0 },
    polarFinish: Math.PI,
    textures: "https://content.highfidelity.com/DomainContent/production/Particles/wispy-smoke.png",
    particleRadius: 0.1,
    color: { red: 0, green: 255, blue: 0 },
    alphaFinish: 0,
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

description: The "PolyLine" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} draws textured, straight lines between a sequence of points. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}.
name: EntityProperties-PolyLine

properties.description: The dimensions of the entity, i.e., the size of the bounding box that contains the lines drawn. Read-only.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description:
The sequence of points to draw lines between. The values are relative to the entity's
    position. A maximum of 70 points can be specified.
properties.name: linePoints

properties.description: The normal vectors for the line's surface at the linePoints. The values are relative to the entity's orientation. Must be specified in order for the entity to render.
properties.name: normals

properties.description: The widths, in m, of the line at the linePoints. Must be specified in order for the entity to render.
properties.name: strokeWidths

properties.description:
The base colors of each point, with values in the range 0.0,0.0,0.0 – 1.0,1.0,1.0. These colors are multiplied with the color of the texture. If there are more line points than stroke colors, the color property value is used for the remaining points.

Warning: The ordinate values are in the range 0.0 – 1.0.
properties.name: strokeColors

properties.description: Used as the color for each point if strokeColors doesn't have a value for the point.
properties.name: color

properties.description:
The URL of a JPG or PNG texture to use for the lines. If you want transparency, use PNG
    format.
properties.name: textures

properties.description: true if the texture is stretched to fill the whole line, false if the texture repeats along the line.
properties.name: isUVModeStretch

properties.description: true if the opacity of the strokes drops off away from the line center, false if it doesn't.
properties.name: glow

properties.description: true if each line segment rotates to face the camera, false if they don't.
properties.name: faceCamera

examples:
<caption>Draw a textured "V".</caption>
var entity = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "PolyLine",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0.75, z: -5 })),
    rotation: MyAvatar.orientation,
    linePoints: [
        { x: -1, y: 0.5, z: 0 },
        { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0 },
        { x: 1, y: 0.5, z: 0 }
    ],
    normals: [
        { x: 0, y: 0, z: 1 },
        { x: 0, y: 0, z: 1 },
        { x: 0, y: 0, z: 1 }
    ],
    strokeWidths: [ 0.1, 0.1, 0.1 ],
    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 },  // Use just the red channel from the image.
    textures: "http://hifi-production.s3.amazonaws.com/DomainContent/Toybox/flowArts/trails.png",
    isUVModeStretch: true,
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

description:
The "PolyVox" {@link Entities.EntityType|EntityType} displays a set of textured voxels. It has properties in addition to the common {@link Entities.EntityProperties|EntityProperties}. If you have two or more neighboring PolyVox entities of the same size abutting each other, you can display them as joined by configuring their voxelSurfaceStyle and various neighbor ID properties.

PolyVox entities uses a library from Volumes of Fun. Their library documentation may be useful to read.
name: EntityProperties-PolyVox

properties.description: The dimensions of the entity.
properties.name: dimensions

properties.description: Integer number of voxels along each axis of the entity, in the range 1,1,1 to 128,128,128. The dimensions of each voxel is dimensions / voxelVolumesize.
properties.name: voxelVolumeSize

properties.description:
Base-64 encoded compressed dump of the PolyVox data. This property is typically not used in scripts directly; rather, functions that manipulate a PolyVox entity update it.

The size of this property increases with the size and complexity of the PolyVox entity, with the size depending on how the particular entity's voxels compress. Because this property value has to fit within a High Fidelity datagram packet, there is a limit to the size and complexity of a PolyVox entity; edits which would result in an overflow are rejected.
properties.name: voxelData

properties.description:
The style of rendering the voxels' surface and how 
    neighboring PolyVox entities are joined.
properties.name: voxelSurfaceStyle

properties.description:
The URL of the texture to map to surfaces perpendicular to the entity's local x-axis. 
    JPG or PNG format. If no texture is specified the surfaces display white.
properties.name: xTextureURL

properties.description:
The URL of the texture to map to surfaces perpendicular to the entity's local y-axis. 
    JPG or PNG format. If no texture is specified the surfaces display white.
properties.name: yTextureURL

properties.description:
The URL of the texture to map to surfaces perpendicular to the entity's local z-axis. 
    JPG or PNG format. If no texture is specified the surfaces display white.
properties.name: zTextureURL

properties.description:
The ID of the neighboring PolyVox entity in the entity's -ve local x-axis 
    direction, if you want them joined. Set to {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if there is none or you don't want to join them.
properties.name: xNNeighborID

properties.description:
The ID of the neighboring PolyVox entity in the entity's -ve local y-axis 
    direction, if you want them joined. Set to {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if there is none or you don't want to join them.
properties.name: yNNeighborID

properties.description:
The ID of the neighboring PolyVox entity in the entity's -ve local z-axis 
    direction, if you want them joined. Set to {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if there is none or you don't want to join them.
properties.name: zNNeighborID

properties.description:
The ID of the neighboring PolyVox entity in the entity's +ve local x-axis 
    direction, if you want them joined. Set to {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if there is none or you don't want to join them.
properties.name: xPNeighborID

properties.description:
The ID of the neighboring PolyVox entity in the entity's +ve local y-axis 
    direction, if you want them joined. Set to {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if there is none or you don't want to join them.
properties.name: yPNeighborID

properties.description:
The ID of the neighboring PolyVox entity in the entity's +ve local z-axis 
    direction, if you want them joined. Set to {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if there is none or you don't want to join them.
properties.name: zPNeighborID

examples:
<caption>Create a textured PolyVox sphere.</caption>
var position = Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0.5, z: -8 }));
var texture = "http://public.highfidelity.com/cozza13/tuscany/Concrete2.jpg";
var polyVox = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "PolyVox",
    position: position,
    dimensions: { x: 2, y: 2, z: 2 },
    xTextureURL: texture,
    yTextureURL: texture,
    zTextureURL: texture,
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});
Entities.setVoxelSphere(polyVox, position, 0.8, 255);
