description:
The Controller.Hardware.Keyboard object has properties representing keyboard, mouse, and display touch events. The property values are integer IDs, uniquely identifying each output. Read-only.

These events can be mapped to actions or functions or Controller.Standard items in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. For presses, each data value is either 1.0 for "true" or 0.0 for "false".

PropertyTypeDataDescription
0 – 9numbernumberA "0" – "1" key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
A – ZnumbernumberA "A" – "Z" key on the keyboard is pressed.
SpacenumbernumberThe space bar on the keyboard is pressed.
TabnumbernumberThe tab key on the keyboard is pressed.
ShiftnumbernumberThe shift key on the keyboard is pressed.
ControlnumbernumberThe control key on the keyboard is pressed. (The "Command" key on OSX.)
LeftnumbernumberThe left arrow key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
RightnumbernumberThe right arrow key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
UpnumbernumberThe up arrow key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
DownnumbernumberThe down arrow key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
PgUpnumbernumberThe page up key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
PgDownnumbernumberThe page down key on the keyboard or keypad is pressed.
LeftMouseButtonnumbernumberThe left mouse button is pressed.
MiddleMouseButtonnumbernumberThe middle mouse button is pressed.
RightMouseButtonnumbernumberThe right mouse button is pressed.
LeftMouseClickednumbernumberThe left mouse button was clicked.
MiddleMouseClickednumbernumberThe middle mouse button was clicked.
RightMouseClickednumbernumberThe right mouse button was clicked.
MouseMoveRightnumbernumberThe mouse moved right. The data value is how far it moved.
MouseMoveLeftnumbernumberThe mouse moved left. The data value is how far it moved.
MouseMoveUpnumbernumberThe mouse moved up. The data value is how far it moved.
MouseMoveDownnumbernumberThe mouse moved down. The data value is how far it moved.
MouseXnumbernumberThe mouse x-coordinate changed. The data value is its new x-coordinate value.
MouseYnumbernumberThe mouse y-coordinate changed. The data value is its new y-coordinate value.
MouseWheelRightnumbernumberThe mouse wheel rotated right. The data value is the number of units rotated (typically 1.0).
MouseWheelLeftnumbernumberThe mouse wheel rotated left. The data value is the number of units rotated (typically 1.0).
MouseWheelUpnumbernumberThe mouse wheel rotated up. The data value is the number of units rotated (typically 1.0).

Warning: The mouse wheel in an ordinary mouse generates left/right wheel events instead of up/down.

MouseWheelDownnumbernumberThe mouse wheel rotated down. The data value is the number of units rotated (typically 1.0).

Warning: The mouse wheel in an ordinary mouse generates left/right wheel events instead of up/down.

TouchpadRightnumbernumberThe average touch on a touch-enabled device moved right. The data value is how far the average position of all touch points moved.
TouchpadLeftnumbernumberThe average touch on a touch-enabled device moved left. The data value is how far the average position of all touch points moved.
TouchpadUpnumbernumberThe average touch on a touch-enabled device moved up. The data value is how far the average position of all touch points moved.
TouchpadDownnumbernumberThe average touch on a touch-enabled device moved down. The data value is how far the average position of all touch points moved.
name: Hardware-Keyboard

description:
An integer DWORD (unsigned 32 bit) message with bits having values as follows:
00000000 0vvvvvvv 0nnnnnnn 1sss cccc

Where:

  • v = Velocity.
  • n = Note.
  • s = Status - {@link Midi.MidiStatus}
  • c = Channel.

The number in the first bit of each byte denotes whether it is a command (1) or data (0).
name: RawMidiMessage

description:

ValueDescription
8Note off.
9Note on.
10Polyphonic key pressure.
11Control change.
12Program change.
13Channel pressure.
14Pitch bend.
15System message.

The location API provides facilities related to your current location in the metaverse.

Getter/Setter

You can get and set your current metaverse address by directly reading a string value from and writing a string value to the location object. This is an alternative to using the location.href property or other object functions.
name: location

properties.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the domain you're visiting. Is {@link Uuid(0)|Uuid.NULL} if you're not connected to the domain or are in a serverless domain. Read-only.
properties.name: domainID

properties.description: The name of the domain for your current metaverse address (e.g., "AvatarIsland", localhost, or an IP address). Is blank if you're in a serverless domain. Read-only.
properties.name: hostname

properties.description: Your current metaverse address (e.g., "hifi://avatarisland/15,-10,26/0,0,0,1") regardless of whether or not you're connected to the domain. Starts with "file:///" if you're in a serverless domain. Read-only.
properties.name: href

properties.description: true if you're connected to the domain in your current href metaverse address, otherwise false.
properties.name: isConnected

properties.description: The location and orientation in your current href metaverse address (e.g., "/15,-10,26/0,0,0,1"). Read-only.
properties.name: pathname

properties.description: The place name in your current href metaverse address (e.g., "AvatarIsland"). Is blank if your hostname is an IP address. Read-only.
properties.name: placename

properties.description: The protocol of your current href metaverse address (e.g., "hifi"). Read-only.
properties.name: protocol

description:
The reasons for an address lookup via the metaverse API are defined by numeric values:

Name Value Description
UserInput 0 User-typed input.
Back 1 Address from a {@link location.goBack|goBack} call.
Forward 2 Address from a {@link location.goForward|goForward} call.
StartupFromSettings 3 Initial location at Interface start-up from settings.
DomainPathResponse 4 A named path in the domain.
Internal 5 An internal attempt to resolve an alternative path.
AttemptedRefresh 6 A refresh after connecting to a domain.
Suggestions 7 Address from the Goto dialog.
VisitUserFromPAL 8 User from the People dialog.

function onLocationChangeRequired(newPosition, hasOrientationChange, newOrientation, shouldFaceLocation) {

description:
The reasons that you may be refused connection to a domain are defined by numeric values:

Reason Value Description
Unknown 0 Some unknown reason.
ProtocolMismatch 1 The communications protocols of the domain and your Interface are not the same.
LoginError 2 You could not be logged into the domain.
NotAuthorized 3 You are not authorized to connect to the domain.
TooManyUsers 4 The domain already has its maximum number of users.
TimedOut 5 Connecting to the domain timed out.
name: ConnectionRefusedReason

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts • Server Entity Scripts • Assignment Client Scripts

The Messages API enables text and data to be sent between scripts over named "channels". A channel can have an arbitrary name to help separate messaging between different sets of scripts.

Note: To call a function in another script, you should use one of the following rather than sending a message:

  • {@link Entities.callEntityClientMethod}
  • {@link Entities.callEntityMethod}
  • {@link Entities.callEntityServerMethod}
  • {@link Script.callEntityScriptMethod}
name: Messages

description: Sends a text message on a channel.
name: sendMessage

params.description: The channel to send the message on.
params.name: channel

params.description: The message to send.
params.name: message

params.description:
If false then the message is sent to all Interface, client entity, server entity, and assignment client scripts in the domain.

If true then: if sent from an Interface or client entity script it is received by all Interface and client entity scripts; if sent from a server entity script it is received by all entity server scripts; and if sent from an assignment client script it is received only by that same assignment client script.
params.name: localOnly

examples:
<caption>Send and receive a message.</caption>
// Receiving script.
var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";

function onMessageReceived(channel, message, sender, localOnly) {
    print("Message received:");
    print("- channel: " + channel);
    print("- message: " + message);
    print("- sender: " + sender);
    print("- localOnly: " + localOnly);
}

Messages.subscribe(channelName);
Messages.messageReceived.connect(onMessageReceived);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Messages.messageReceived.disconnect(onMessageReceived);
    Messages.unsubscribe(channelName);
});


// Sending script.
var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";
var message = "Hello";
Messages.sendMessage(channelName, message);

description: Sends a text message locally on a channel. This is the same as calling {@link Messages.sendMessage|sendMessage} with localOnly == true.
name: sendLocalMessage

params.description: The channel to send the message on.
params.name: channel

params.description: The message to send.
params.name: message

description: Sends a data message on a channel.
name: sendData

params.description: The channel to send the data on.
params.name: channel

params.description: The data to send. The data is handled as a byte stream, for example, as may be provided via a JavaScript Int8Array object.
params.name: data

params.description:
If false then the message is sent to all Interface, client entity, server entity, and assignment client scripts in the domain.

If true then: if sent from an Interface or client entity script it is received by all Interface and client entity scripts; if sent from a server entity script it is received by all entity server scripts; and if sent from an assignment client script it is received only by that same assignment client script.
params.name: localOnly

examples:
<caption>Send and receive data.</caption>
// Receiving script.
var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";

function onDataReceived(channel, data, sender, localOnly) {
    var int8data = new Int8Array(data);
    var dataAsString = "";
    for (var i = 0; i < int8data.length; i++) {
        if (i > 0) {
            dataAsString += ", ";
        }
        dataAsString += int8data[i];
    }
    print("Data received:");
    print("- channel: " + channel);
    print("- data: " + dataAsString);
    print("- sender: " + sender);
    print("- localOnly: " + localOnly);
}

Messages.subscribe(channelName);
Messages.dataReceived.connect(onDataReceived);

Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {
    Messages.dataReceived.disconnect(onDataReceived);
    Messages.unsubscribe(channelName);
});


// Sending script.
var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";
var int8data = new Int8Array([1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13]);
Messages.sendData(channelName, int8data.buffer);

description: Gets the URLs of all resources in the cache.

<caption>Report cached resources.</caption>
// Replace AnimationCache with ModelCache, SoundCache, or TextureCache as appropriate.

var cachedResources = AnimationCache.getResourceList();
print("Cached resources: " + JSON.stringify(cachedResources));

name: updateTotalSize

params.description: Delta size.
params.name: deltaSize

deprecated: This function is deprecated and will be removed.

description: Prefetches a resource.
name: prefetch

params.description: The URL of the resource to prefetch.
params.name: url

returns.description: A resource object.

examples:
<caption>Prefetch a resource and wait until it has loaded.</caption>
// Replace AnimationCache with ModelCache, SoundCache, or TextureCache as appropriate.
// TextureCache has its own version of this function.

var resourceURL = "https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/hifi-content/clement/production/animations/sitting_idle.fbx";
var resourceObject = AnimationCache.prefetch(resourceURL);

function checkIfResourceLoaded(state) {
    if (state === Resource.State.FINISHED) {
        print("Resource loaded and ready.");
    } else if (state === Resource.State.FAILED) {
        print("Resource not loaded.");
    }
}

// Resource may have already been loaded.
print("Resource state: " + resourceObject.state);
checkIfResourceLoaded(resourceObject.state);

// Resource may still be loading.
resourceObject.stateChanged.connect(function (state) {
    print("Resource state changed to: " + state);
    checkIfResourceLoaded(state);
});

description: The "offset" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} moves an entity so that it is a defined distance away from a target point. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}:
name: ActionArguments-Offset

properties.description: The target point to offset the entity from.
properties.name: pointToOffsetFrom

properties.description: The distance away from the target point to position the entity.
properties.name: linearDistance

properties.description:
Controls how long it takes for the entity's position to catch up with the
    target offset. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the action 
    is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: linearTimeScale

description: The "tractor" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} moves and rotates an entity to a target position and orientation, optionally relative to another entity. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}:
name: ActionArguments-Tractor

properties.description: If an entity ID, the targetPosition and targetRotation are relative to the entity's position and rotation.
properties.name: otherID

properties.description: If a joint index in the otherID entity, the targetPosition and targetRotation are relative to the entity joint's position and rotation.
properties.name: otherJointIndex

properties.description: The target position.
properties.name: targetPosition

properties.description: The target rotation.
properties.name: targetRotation

properties.description:
Controls how long it takes for the entity's position to catch up with the
    target position. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the action
    is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: linearTimeScale

properties.description:
Controls how long it takes for the entity's orientation to catch up with the
    target orientation. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the
    action is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: angularTimeScale

description: The "travel-oriented" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} orients an entity to align with its direction of travel. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}:
name: ActionArguments-TravelOriented

properties.description: The axis of the entity to align with the entity's direction of travel.
properties.name: forward

properties.description:
Controls how long it takes for the entity's orientation to catch up with the 
    direction of travel. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the 
    action is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: angularTimeScale

description: The "slider" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} lets an entity slide and rotate along an axis, or connects two entities that slide and rotate along a shared axis. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}:
name: ActionArguments-Slider

properties.description:
The most negative linear offset from the entity's initial point that the entity can 
    have along the slider.

properties.description:
The most positive linear offset from the entity's initial point that the entity can 
    have along the slider.
properties.name: linearHigh

The most negative angle that the entity can rotate about the axis if the action

properties.name: angularLow

properties.description:
The most positive angle that the entity can rotate about the axis if the action 
    involves only one entity, otherwise the most positive angle the rotation can be between the two entities. In radians.
properties.name: angularHigh

properties.description: The current linear offset the entity is from its initial point if the action involves only one entity, otherwise the linear offset between the two entities' action points. Read-only.
properties.name: linearPosition

properties.description: The current angular offset of the entity from its initial rotation if the action involves only one entity, otherwise the angular offset between the two entities. In radians. Read-only.

Different entity action types have different arguments: some common to all actions (listed in the table) and some specific

description:
An entity's physics motion type may be one of the following:

ValueDescription
"static"There is no motion because the entity is locked — its locked property is set to true.
"kinematic"Motion is applied without physical laws (e.g., damping) because the entity is not locked and has its dynamic property set to false.
"dynamic"Motion is applied according to physical laws (e.g., damping) because the entity is not locked and has its dynamic property set to true.
name: PhysicsMotionType

properties.description: The last-modified and expiry times for the cache item.

properties.description: The URL to associate with the cache item. Must start with "atp:" or "cache:". If not specified, the URL is "atp:" followed by the SHA256 hash of the content.

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts • Server Entity Scripts • Assignment Client Scripts

The Assets API provides facilities for interacting with the domain's asset server and the client cache.

Assets are stored in the asset server in files with SHA256 names. These files are mapped to user-friendly URLs of the format: atp:/path/filename. The assets may optionally be baked, in which case a request for the original unbaked version of the asset is automatically redirected to the baked version. The asset data may optionally be stored as compressed.

The client cache can be accessed directly, using "atp:" or "cache:" URLs. Interface, avatar, and assignment client scripts can write to the cache. All script types can read from the cache.
name: Assets

description: Called when an {@link Assets.uploadData} call is complete.
name: uploadDataCallback

params.description: The raw URL of the file that the content is stored in, with atp: as the scheme and the SHA256 hash as the filename (with no extension).
params.name: url

params.description: The SHA256 hash of the content.
params.name: hash

description:
Uploads content to the asset server, storing it in a SHA256-named file.

Note: The asset server destroys any unmapped SHA256-named file at server restart. Use {@link Assets.setMapping} to set a path-to-hash mapping for the new file.
name: uploadData

params.description: The content to upload.
params.name: data

params.description: The function to call upon completion.
params.name: callback

examples:
<caption>Store a string in the asset server.</caption>
Assets.uploadData("Hello world!", function (url, hash) {
    print("URL: " + url);  // atp:0a1b...9g
    Assets.setMapping("/assetsExamples/helloWorld.txt", hash, function (error) {
        if (error) {
            print("ERROR: Could not set mapping!");
            return;
        }
    });
});

description: Called when an {@link Assets.downloadData} call is complete.
name: downloadDataCallback

params.description: The content that was downloaded.
params.name: data

params.description: The success or failure of the download.
params.name: error

description: Downloads content from the asset server, from a SHA256-named file.
name: downloadData

params.description: The raw URL of asset to download: atp: followed by the assets's SHA256 hash.
params.name: url

params.description: The function to call upon completion.
params.name: callback

examples:
<caption>Store and retrieve a string from the asset server.</caption>
var assetURL;

// Store the string.
Assets.uploadData("Hello world!", function (url, hash) {
    assetURL = url;
    print("url: " + assetURL);  // atp:a0g89...
    Assets.setMapping("/assetsExamples/helloWorld.txt", hash, function (error) {
        if (error) {
            print("ERROR: Could not set mapping!");
            return;
        }
    });
});

// Retrieve the string.
Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Assets.downloadData(assetURL, function (data, error) {
        print("Downloaded data: " + data);
        print("Error: " + JSON.stringify(error));
    });
}, 1000);

params.name: hash

description:
Gets the hash for a path within the asset server. The hash is for the unbaked or baked version of the
asset, according to the asset server setting for the particular path.
name: getMapping

params.description: The path to a file in the asset server to get the hash of.
params.name: path

params.description: The function to call upon completion.
params.name: callback

examples:
<caption>Report the hash of an asset server item.</caption>
var assetPath = Window.browseAssets();
if (assetPath) {
    var mapping = Assets.getMapping(assetPath, function (error, hash) {
        print("Asset: " + assetPath);
        print("- hash:  " + hash);
        print("- error: " + error);
    });
}

params.description: What to download and download options. If a string, the mapped path or hash to download, optionally including a leading "atp:".
params.name: source

params.description:
If an object, then the scope that the callback function is defined in. This object is bound to this when the function is called.

Otherwise, the function to call upon completion. This may be an inline function or a function identifier.
params.name: scopeOrCallback

params.description:
Used if scopeOrCallback specifies the scope.

The function to call upon completion. May be an inline function, a function identifier, or the name of a function in a string. If the name of a function or a function identifier, it must be a member of the scope specified by scopeOrCallback.
params.name: callback

examples:
<caption>Retrieve a string from the asset server.</caption>
Assets.getAsset(
    {
        url: "/assetsExamples/helloWorld.txt",
        responseType: "text"
    },
    function (error, result) {
        if (error) {
            print("ERROR: Data not downloaded");
        } else {
            print("Data: " + result.response);
        }
    }
);

description:
Adds avatars to the audio solo list. If the audio solo list is not empty, only audio from the avatars in the list is 
played.
name: addToSoloList

params.description: Avatar IDs to add to the solo list.
params.name: ids

examples:
<caption>Listen to a single nearby avatar for a short while.</caption>
// Find nearby avatars.
var RANGE = 100; // m
var nearbyAvatars = AvatarList.getAvatarsInRange(MyAvatar.position, RANGE);

// Remove own avatar from list.
var myAvatarIndex = nearbyAvatars.indexOf(MyAvatar.sessionUUID);
if (myAvatarIndex !== -1) {
    nearbyAvatars.splice(myAvatarIndex, 1);
}

if (nearbyAvatars.length > 0) {
    // Listen to only one of the nearby avatars.
    var avatarName = AvatarList.getAvatar(nearbyAvatars[0]).displayName;
    print("Listening only to " + avatarName);
    Audio.addToSoloList([nearbyAvatars[0]]);

    // Stop listening to only the one avatar after a short while.
    Script.setTimeout(function () {
        print("Finished listening only to " + avatarName);
        Audio.resetSoloList();
    }, 10000); // 10s

} else {
    print("No nearby avatars");
}

description: Clears the audio solo list.
name: resetSoloList

description:
Gets whether your microphone audio is echoed back to you from the server. When enabled, microphone audio is echoed only 
if you're unmuted or are using push-to-talk.
name: getServerEcho

returns.description: true if echoing microphone audio back to you from the server is enabled, false if it isn't.

description:
Sets whether your microphone audio is echoed back to you from the server. When enabled, microphone audio is echoed 
only if you're unmuted or are using push-to-talk.
name: setServerEcho

params.description: true to enable echoing microphone back to you from the server, false to disable.
params.name: serverEcho

description:
Toggles the echoing of microphone audio back to you from the server. When enabled, microphone audio is echoed only if 
you're unmuted or are using push-to-talk.
name: toggleServerEcho

description:
Gets whether your microphone audio is echoed back to you by the client. When enabled, microphone audio is echoed 
even if you're muted or not using push-to-talk.
name: getLocalEcho

returns.description: true if echoing microphone audio back to you from the client is enabled, false if it isn't.

description:
Sets whether your microphone audio is echoed back to you by the client. When enabled, microphone audio is echoed 
even if you're muted or not using push-to-talk.
name: setLocalEcho

tags.title: parm
tags.text: {boolean} localEcho - true to enable echoing microphone audio back to you from the client, false to disable.
tags.value: {boolean} localEcho - true to enable echoing microphone audio back to you from the client, false to disable.

examples:
<caption>Echo local audio for a few seconds.</caption>
Audio.setLocalEcho(true);
Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Audio.setLocalEcho(false);
}, 3000); // 3s

description:
Toggles the echoing of microphone audio back to you by the client. When enabled, microphone audio is echoed even if 
you're muted or not using push-to-talk.
name: toggleLocalEcho

description: Starts playing or "injecting" the content of an audio file. The sound is played globally (sent to the audio mixer) so that everyone hears it, unless the injectorOptions has localOnly set to true in which case only the client hears the sound played. No sound is played if sent to the audio mixer but the client is not connected to an audio mixer. The {@link AudioInjector} object returned by the function can be used to control the playback and get information about its current state.
name: playSound

params.description:
The content of an audio file, loaded using {@link SoundCache.getSound}. See 
{@link SoundObject} for supported formats.
params.name: sound

params.description:
Configures where and how the audio injector plays the 
    audio file.
params.name: injectorOptions

returns.description: The audio injector that plays the audio file.

examples:
<caption>Play a sound.</caption>
var sound = SoundCache.getSound("http://hifi-content.s3.amazonaws.com/ken/samples/forest_ambiX.wav");

function playSound() {
    var injectorOptions = {
        position: MyAvatar.position
    };
    var injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);
}

function onSoundReady() {
    sound.ready.disconnect(onSoundReady);
    playSound();
}

if (sound.downloaded) {
    playSound();
} else {
    sound.ready.connect(onSoundReady);
}

description: Starts playing the content of an audio file locally (isn't sent to the audio mixer). This is the same as calling {@link Audio.playSound} with {@link AudioInjector.AudioInjectorOptions} localOnly set true and the specified position.
name: playSystemSound

params.description:
The content of an audio file, which is loaded using {@link SoundCache.getSound}. See 
{@link SoundObject} for supported formats.
params.name: sound

returns.description: The audio injector that plays the audio file.

description: Sets whether the audio input should be used in stereo. If the audio input doesn't support stereo then setting a value of true has no effect.
name: setStereoInput

params.description: true if the audio input should be used in stereo, otherwise false.
params.name: stereo

description: Gets whether the audio input is used in stereo.
name: isStereoInput

returns.description: true if the audio input is used in stereo, otherwise false.

description:
Triggered when the client is muted by the mixer because their loudness value for the noise background has reached the 
threshold set for the domain (in the server settings).
name: mutedByMixer

description:
Triggered when the client is muted by the mixer because they're within a certain radius (50m) of someone who requested 
the mute through Developer > Audio > Mute Environment.
name: environmentMuted

description: Triggered when the client receives its first packet from the audio mixer.
name: receivedFirstPacket

description: Triggered when the client is disconnected from the audio mixer.
name: disconnected

description: Triggered when the noise gate is opened. The input audio signal is no longer blocked (fully attenuated) because it has risen above an adaptive threshold set just above the noise floor. Only occurs if Audio.noiseReduction is true.
name: noiseGateOpened

description: Triggered when the noise gate is closed. The input audio signal is blocked (fully attenuated) because it has fallen below an adaptive threshold set just above the noise floor. Only occurs if Audio.noiseReduction is true.
name: noiseGateClosed

description: Triggered when a frame of audio input is processed.
name: inputReceived

params.description: The audio input processed.
params.name: inputSamples

description: Triggered when the input audio use changes between mono and stereo.
name: isStereoInputChanged

params.description: true if the input audio is stereo, otherwise false.
params.name: isStereo

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts • Server Entity Scripts • Assignment Client Scripts

The File API provides some facilities for working with the file system.
name: File

description: Extracts a filename from a URL, where the filename is specified in the query part of the URL as filename=.
name: convertUrlToPath

params.description: The URL to extract the filename from.
params.name: url

returns.description: The filename specified in the URL; an empty string if no filename is specified.

examples:
<caption>Extract a filename from a URL.</caption>
var url = "http://domain.tld/path/page.html?filename=file.ext";
print("File name: " + File.convertUrlToPath(url));  // file.ext

description: Unzips a file in the local file system to a new, unique temporary directory.
name: runUnzip

params.description: The path of the zip file in the local file system. May have a leading "file:///". Need not have a ".zip" extension if it is in a temporary directory (as created by {@link File.getTempDir|getTempDir}).
params.name: path

params.description: Not used.
params.name: url

params.description: Not used by user scripts. The value is simply passed through to the {@link File.unzipResult|unzipResult} signal.
params.name: autoAdd

params.description: Set to true if path has a ".zip" extension, false if it doesn't (but should still be treated as a zip file).
params.name: isZip

params.description: Not used by user scripts. The value is simply passed through to the {@link File.unzipResult|unzipResult} signal.
params.name: isBlocks

examples:
<caption>Select and unzip a file.</caption>
File.unzipResult.connect(function (zipFile, unzipFiles, autoAdd, isZip, isBlocks) {
    print("File.unzipResult()");
    print("- zipFile: " + zipFile);
    print("- unzipFiles(" + unzipFiles.length + "): " + unzipFiles);
    print("- autoAdd: " + autoAdd);
    print("- isZip: " + isZip);
    print("- isBlocks: " + isBlocks);
});

var zipFile = Window.browse("Select a Zip File", "", "*.zip");
if (zipFile) {
    File.runUnzip(zipFile, "", false, true, false);
} else {
    print("Zip file not selected.");
}

description: A keyboard key event.
name: KeyEvent

properties.description: The Qt keyboard code of the key pressed. For a list of keyboard codes, see http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qt.html#Key-enum.
properties.name: key

properties.description: A string describing the key. For example, "a" for the "A" key if the Shift is not pressed, "F1" for the F1 key, "SPACE" for the space bar.
properties.name: text

properties.description: true if a Shift key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false.
properties.name: isShifted

properties.description: true if a meta key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false. On Windows the "meta" key is the Windows key; on OSX it is the Control (Splat) key.
properties.name: isMeta

properties.description: true if a control key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false. On Windows the "control" key is the Ctrl key; on OSX it is the Command key.
properties.name: isControl

properties.description: true if an Alt key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false.
properties.name: isAlt

properties.description: true if the key is on the numeric keypad, otherwise false.
properties.name: isKeypad

properties.description: true if the event is a repeat for key that is being held down, otherwise false.
properties.name: isAutoRepeat

<caption>Report the KeyEvent details for each key press.</caption>
Controller.keyPressEvent.connect(function (event) {

});

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts • Server Entity Scripts • Assignment Client Scripts

The Mat4 API provides facilities for generating and using 4 x 4 matrices. These matrices are typically used to represent transforms (scale, rotate, and translate) that convert one coordinate system into another, or perspective transforms that convert 3D points into screen coordinates.
name: Mat4

description: Multiplies two matrices.
name: multiply

params.description: The first matrix.
params.name: m1

params.description: The second matrix.
params.name: m2

returns.description: m1 multiplied with m2.

description: Creates a matrix that represents a rotation and translation.
name: createFromRotAndTrans

params.description: The rotation.
params.name: rot

params.description: The translation.
params.name: trans

returns.description: The matrix that represents the rotation and translation.

examples:
<caption>Create a matrix with rotation and translation.</caption>
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(30, 45, 60);
var trans = { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromRotAndTrans(rot, trans);
Mat4.print("Matrix:", matrix);
// Matrix: dmat4x4((0.353553, 0.612372, -0.707107, 0.000000),
//                 (-0.573223, 0.739199, 0.353553, 0.000000),
//                 (0.739199, 0.280330, 0.612372, 0.000000),
//                 (10.000000, 11.000000, 12.000000, 1.000000))

description: Creates a matrix that represents a scale, rotation, and translation.
name: createFromScaleRotAndTrans

params.description: The scale.
params.name: scale

params.description: The rotation.
params.name: rot

params.description: The translation.
params.name: trans

returns.description: The matrix that represents the scale, rotation, and translation.

examples:
<caption>Create a matrix with scale, rotation, and translation.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(30, 45, 60);
var trans = { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);
Mat4.print("Matrix:", matrix);
// Matrix: dmat4x4((0.707107, 1.224745, -1.414214, 0.000000),
//                 (-1.146447, 1.478398, 0.707107, 0.000000),
//                 (1.478398, 0.560660, 1.224745, 0.000000),
//                 (10.000000, 11.000000, 12.000000, 1.000000))

description: Creates a matrix from columns of values.
name: createFromColumns

params.description: Column 0 values.
params.name: col0

params.description: Column 1 values.
params.name: col1

params.description: Column 2 values.
params.name: col2

params.description: Column 3 valuse.
params.name: col3

returns.description: The matrix with the specified columns values.

description: Creates a matrix from an array of values.
name: createFromArray

params.description: The array of values, starting with column 0.
params.name: arr

returns.description: The matrix with the specified values.

description: Extracts the translation from a matrix.
name: extractTranslation

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The translation contained in the matrix.

examples:
<caption>Extract the translation from a matrix.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(30, 45, 60);
var trans = { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);

trans = Mat4.extractTranslation(matrix);
print("Translation: " + JSON.stringify(trans));
// Translation: {"x":10,"y":11,"z":12}

description: Extracts the rotation from a matrix.
name: extractRotation

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The rotation contained in the matrix.

examples:
<caption>Extract the rotation from a matrix.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(30, 45, 60);
var trans = { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);

rot = Mat4.extractRotation(matrix);
print("Rotation: " + JSON.stringify(Quat.safeEulerAngles(rot)));
// Rotation: {"x":29.999998092651367,"y":45.00000762939453,"z":60.000003814697266}

description: Extracts the scale from a matrix.
name: extractScale

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The scale contained in the matrix.

examples:
<caption>Extract the scale from a matrix.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(30, 45, 60);
var trans = { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);

scale = Mat4.extractScale(matrix);
print("Scale: " + JSON.stringify(scale));
// Scale: {"x":1.9999998807907104,"y":1.9999998807907104,"z":1.9999998807907104}

description: Transforms a point into a new coordinate system: the point value is scaled, rotated, and translated.
name: transformPoint

params.description: The transform to the new coordinate system.
params.name: m

params.description: The point to transform.
params.name: point

returns.description: The point in the new coordinate system.

examples:
<caption>Transform a point.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 45, 0);
var trans = { x: 0, y: 10, z: 0 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);

var point = { x: 1, y: 1, z: 1 };
var transformedPoint = Mat4.transformPoint(matrix, point);
print("Transformed point: " + JSON.stringify(transformedPoint));
// Transformed point: { "x": 2.8284270763397217, "y": 12, "z": -2.384185791015625e-7 }

description: Transforms a vector into a new coordinate system: the vector is scaled and rotated.
name: transformVector

params.description: The transform to the new coordinate system.
params.name: m

params.description: The vector to transform.
params.name: vector

returns.description: The vector in the new coordinate system.

examples:
<caption>Transform a vector.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 45, 0);
var trans = { x: 0, y: 10, z: 0 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);

var vector = { x: 1, y: 1, z: 1 };
var transformedVector = Mat4.transformVector(matrix, vector);
print("Transformed vector: " + JSON.stringify(transformedVector));
// Transformed vector: { "x": 2.8284270763397217, "y": 2, "z": -2.384185791015625e-7 }

description: Calculates the inverse of a matrix.
name: inverse

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The inverse of the matrix.

examples:
<caption>A matrix multiplied with its inverse is the unit matrix.</caption>
var scale = Vec3.multiply(2, Vec3.ONE);
var rot = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(30, 45, 60);
var trans = { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 };
var matrix = Mat4.createFromScaleRotAndTrans(scale, rot, trans);
var inverse = Mat4.inverse(matrix);
var multiplied = Mat4.multiply(matrix, inverse);
Mat4.print("Multiplied:", multiplied);
//Multiplied: dmat4x4((1.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000),
//                    (0.000000, 1.000000, -0.000000, 0.000000),
//                    (0.000000, 0.000000, 1.000000, 0.000000),
//                    (0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000001, 1.000000))

description:
Gets the "forward" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the rotation contained in a matrix. The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.

Synonym for {@link Mat4(0).getForward|getForward}.
name: getFront

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

description:
Gets the "forward" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the rotation contained in a
matrix. The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getForward

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by the rotation in the matrix.

examples:
<caption>Demonstrate that the "forward" direction is the negative z-axis.</caption>
var rot = Quat.IDENTITY;
var trans = Vec3.ZERO;
var matrix = Mat4.createFromRotAndTrans(rot, trans);
var forward = Mat4.getForward(matrix);
print("Forward: " + JSON.stringify(forward));
// Forward: {"x":0,"y":0,"z":-1}

description:
Gets the "right" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the rotation contained in a matrix. 
The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getRight

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The x-axis rotated by the rotation in the matrix.

description:
Gets the "up" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the rotation contained in a matrix. The 
High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getUp

params.description: The matrix.
params.name: m

returns.description: The y-axis rotated by the rotation in the matrix.

description: Prints a matrix to the program log as a label followed by the matrix's values.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The matrix to print.
params.name: m

params.description: true to transpose the matrix before printing (so that it prints the matrix's rows), false to not transpose the matrix (so that it prints the matrix's columns).
params.name: transpose

description: A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Menu.addMenuItem} to create a new menu item. If none of the properties, position, beforeItem, afterItem, or grouping are specified, the menu item will be placed at the end of the menu.
name: MenuItemProperties

properties.description: Name of the menu. Nested menus can be described using the ">" character.
properties.name: menuName

properties.description: Name of the menu item.
properties.name: menuItemName

properties.description: Whether or not the menu item is checkable.
properties.name: isCheckable

properties.description: Whether or not the menu item is checked.

properties.description: Whether or not the menu item is a separator.

properties.description: A shortcut key that triggers the menu item.
properties.name: shortcutKey

properties.description: A {@link KeyEvent} that specifies a key that triggers the menu item.
properties.name: shortcutKeyEvent

properties.description: The position to place the new menu item. An integer number with 0 being the first menu item.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The name of the menu item to place this menu item before.
properties.name: beforeItem

properties.description: The name of the menu item to place this menu item after.
properties.name: afterItem

properties.description: The name of grouping to add this menu item to.
properties.name: grouping

description: A controller mouse movement or button event.

properties.name: button

properties.name: isLeftButton

properties.name: isMeta

properties.name: isAlt

<caption>Report the MouseEvent details for each mouse move.</caption>

});

description: A quaternion value. See also the {@link Quat(0)|Quat} API.
name: Quat

properties.description: Imaginary component i.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Imaginary component j.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Imaginary component k.
properties.name: z

properties.description: Real component.
properties.name: w

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts • Server Entity Scripts • Assignment Client Scripts

The Quat API provides facilities for generating and manipulating quaternions. Quaternions should be used in preference to Euler angles wherever possible because quaternions don't suffer from the problem of gimbal lock.
name: Quat

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0, w: 1 } : The identity rotation, i.e., no rotation. Read-only.
properties.name: IDENTITY

examples: Print the IDENTITY value. print(JSON.stringify(Quat.IDENTITY)); // { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0, w: 1 } print(JSON.stringify(Quat.safeEulerAngles(Quat.IDENTITY))); // { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0 }

description: Multiplies two quaternions.
name: multiply

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: q1 multiplied with q2.

examples:
<caption>Calculate the orientation of your avatar's right hand in world coordinates.</caption>
var handController = Controller.Standard.RightHand;
var handPose = Controller.getPoseValue(handController);
if (handPose.valid) {
    var handOrientation = Quat.multiply(MyAvatar.orientation, handPose.rotation);
}

description: Normalizes a quaternion.
name: normalize

params.description: The quaternion to normalize.
params.name: q

returns.description: q normalized to have unit length.

examples:
<caption>Normalize a repeated delta rotation so that maths rounding errors don't accumulate.</caption>
var deltaRotation = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0.1, 0);
var currentRotation = Quat.ZERO;
while (Quat.safeEulerAngles(currentRotation).y < 180) {
    currentRotation = Quat.multiply(deltaRotation, currentRotation);
    currentRotation = Quat.normalize(currentRotation);
    // Use currentRotatation for something.
}

description:
Calculates the conjugate of a quaternion. For a unit quaternion, its conjugate is the same as its 
{@link Quat(0).inverse|Quat.inverse}.
name: conjugate

params.description: The quaternion to conjugate.
params.name: q

returns.description: The conjugate of q.

examples:
<caption>A unit quaternion multiplied by its conjugate is a zero rotation.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);
Quat.print("quaternion", quaternion, true); // dvec3(10.000000, 20.000004, 30.000004)
var conjugate = Quat.conjugate(quaternion);
Quat.print("conjugate", conjugate, true); // dvec3(1.116056, -22.242186, -28.451778)
var identity = Quat.multiply(conjugate, quaternion);
Quat.print("identity", identity, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000)

description:
Calculates a camera orientation given an eye position, point of interest, and "up" direction. The camera's negative 
z-axis is the forward direction. The result has zero roll about its forward direction with respect to the given "up" 
direction.
name: lookAt

params.description: The eye position.
params.name: eye

params.description: The point to look at.
params.name: target

params.description: The "up" direction.
params.name: up

returns.description:
A quaternion that orients the negative z-axis to point along the eye-to-target vector and the x-axis to
be the cross product of the eye-to-target and up vectors.

examples:
<caption>Rotate your view in independent mode to look at the world origin upside down.</caption>
Camera.mode = "independent";
Camera.orientation = Quat.lookAt(Camera.position, Vec3.ZERO, Vec3.UNIT_NEG_Y);

description:
Calculates a camera orientation given an eye position and point of interest. The camera's negative z-axis is the forward 
direction. The result has zero roll about its forward direction.
name: lookAtSimple

params.description: The eye position.
params.name: eye

params.description: The point to look at.
params.name: target

returns.description:
A quaternion that orients the negative z-axis to point along the eye-to-target vector and the x-axis to be
    the cross product of the eye-to-target and an "up" vector. The "up" vector is the y-axis unless the eye-to-target
    vector is nearly aligned with it (i.e., looking near vertically up or down), in which case the x-axis is used as the
    "up" vector.

examples:
<caption>Rotate your view in independent mode to look at the world origin.</caption>
Camera.mode = "independent";
Camera.orientation = Quat.lookAtSimple(Camera.position, Vec3.ZERO);

description: Calculates the shortest rotation from a first vector onto a second.
name: rotationBetween

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The rotation from v1 onto v2.

examples:
<caption>Apply a change in velocity to an entity and rotate it to face the direction it's travelling.</caption>
var newVelocity = Vec3.sum(entityVelocity, deltaVelocity);
var properties = { velocity: newVelocity };
if (Vec3.length(newVelocity) > 0.001) {
    properties.rotation = Quat.rotationBetween(entityVelocity, newVelocity);
}
Entities.editEntity(entityID, properties);
entityVelocity = newVelocity;

description: Generates a quaternion from a {@link Vec3} of Euler angles in degrees.
name: fromVec3Degrees

params.description:
A vector of three Euler angles in degrees, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z
    axes.
params.name: vector

returns.description: A quaternion created from the Euler angles in vector.

examples:
<caption>Zero out pitch and roll from an orientation.</caption>
var eulerAngles = Quat.safeEulerAngles(orientation);
eulerAngles.x = 0;
eulerAngles.z = 0;
var newOrientation = Quat.fromVec3Degrees(eulerAngles);

description: Generates a quaternion from a {@link Vec3} of Euler angles in radians.
name: fromVec3Radians

params.description:
A vector of three Euler angles in radians, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z
    axes.
params.name: vector

returns.description: A quaternion created using the Euler angles in vector.

examples:
<caption>Create a rotation of 180 degrees about the y axis.</caption>
var rotation = Quat.fromVec3Radians({ x: 0, y: Math.PI, z: 0 });

description: Generates a quaternion from pitch, yaw, and roll values in degrees.
name: fromPitchYawRollDegrees

params.description: The pitch angle in degrees.
params.name: pitch

params.description: The yaw angle in degrees.
params.name: yaw

params.description: The roll angle in degrees.
params.name: roll

returns.description: A quaternion created using the pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.

examples:
<caption>Create a rotation of 180 degrees about the y axis.</caption>
var rotation = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDgrees(0, 180, 0 );

description: Generates a quaternion from pitch, yaw, and roll values in radians.
name: fromPitchYawRollRadians

params.description: The pitch angle in radians.
params.name: pitch

params.description: The yaw angle in radians.
params.name: yaw

params.description: The roll angle in radians.
params.name: roll

returns.description: A quaternion created from the pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.

examples:
<caption>Create a rotation of 180 degrees about the y axis.</caption>
var rotation = Quat.fromPitchYawRollRadians(0, Math.PI, 0);

description:
Calculates the inverse of a quaternion. For a unit quaternion, its inverse is the same as its
    {@link Quat(0).conjugate|Quat.conjugate}.
name: inverse

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The inverse of q.

examples:
<caption>A quaternion multiplied by its inverse is a zero rotation.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);
Quat.print("quaternion", quaternion, true); // dvec3(10.000000, 20.000004, 30.000004)
var inverse = Quat.invserse(quaternion);
Quat.print("inverse", inverse, true); // dvec3(1.116056, -22.242186, -28.451778)
var identity = Quat.multiply(inverse, quaternion);
Quat.print("identity", identity, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000)

description: Gets the "front" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the quaternion value. This is a synonym for {@link Quat(0).getForward|Quat.getForward}. The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getFront

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

description: Gets the "forward" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the quaternion value. This is a synonym for {@link Quat(0).getFront|Quat.getFront}. The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getForward

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

examples:
<caption>Demonstrate that the "forward" vector is for the negative z-axis.</caption>
var forward = Quat.getForward(Quat.IDENTITY);
print(JSON.stringify(forward)); // {"x":0,"y":0,"z":-1}

description: Gets the "right" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the quaternion value. The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getRight

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The x-axis rotated by orientation.

description: Gets the "up" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the quaternion value. The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getUp

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The y-axis rotated by orientation.

description:
Calculates the Euler angles for the quaternion, in degrees. (The "safe" in the name signifies that the angle results 
will not be garbage even when the rotation is particularly difficult to decompose with pitches around +/-90 degrees.)
name: safeEulerAngles

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: A {@link Vec3} of Euler angles for the orientation, in degrees, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z axes.

examples:
<caption>Report the camera yaw.</caption>
var eulerAngles = Quat.safeEulerAngles(Camera.orientation);
print("Camera yaw: " + eulerAngles.y);

description: Generates a quaternion given an angle to rotate through and an axis to rotate about.
name: angleAxis

params.description: The angle to rotate through, in degrees.
params.name: angle

params.description: The unit axis to rotate about.
params.name: axis

returns.description: A quaternion that is a rotation through angle degrees about the axis. WARNING: This value is in degrees whereas the value returned by {@link Quat(0).angle|Quat.angle} is in radians.

examples:
<caption>Calculate a rotation of 90 degrees about the direction your camera is looking.</caption>
var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation));

description: Gets the rotation axis for a quaternion.
name: axis

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The normalized rotation axis for q.

examples:
<caption>Get the rotation axis of a quaternion.</caption>
var forward = Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation);
var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, forward);
var axis = Quat.axis(rotation);
print("Forward: " + JSON.stringify(forward));
print("Axis: " + JSON.stringify(axis)); // Same value as forward.

description: Gets the rotation angle for a quaternion.
name: angle

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The rotation angle for q, in radians. WARNING: This value is in radians whereas the value used by {@link Quat(0).angleAxis|Quat.angleAxis} is in degrees.

examples:
<caption>Get the rotation angle of a quaternion.</caption>
var forward = Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation);
var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, forward);
var angle = Quat.angle(rotation);
print("Angle: " + angle * 180 / Math.PI);  // 90 degrees.

description:
Computes a spherical linear interpolation between two rotations, safely handling two rotations that are very similar.
See also, {@link Quat(0).slerp|Quat.slerp}.
name: mix

params.description: The beginning rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: The ending rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. Specifies the proportion of q2's value to return in favor of q1's value. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical linear interpolation between rotations q1 and q2.

examples:
<caption>Animate between one rotation and another.</caption>
var dt = amountOfTimeThatHasPassed;
var mixFactor = amountOfTimeThatHasPassed / TIME_TO_COMPLETE;
if (mixFactor > 1) {
    mixFactor = 1;
}
var newRotation = Quat.mix(startRotation, endRotation, mixFactor);

description:
Computes a spherical linear interpolation between two rotations, for rotations that are not very similar.
See also, {@link Quat(0).mix|Quat.mix}.
name: slerp

params.description: The beginning rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: The ending rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. Specifies the proportion of q2's value to return in favor of q1's value. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical linear interpolation between rotations q1 and q2.

description: Computes a spherical quadrangle interpolation between two rotations along a path oriented toward two other rotations. Equivalent to: Quat.slerp(Quat.slerp(q1, q2, alpha), Quat.slerp(s1, s2, alpha), 2 * alpha * (1.0 - alpha)).
name: squad

params.description: Initial rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: Final rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: First control point.
params.name: s1

params.description: Second control point.
params.name: s2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical quadrangle interpolation between rotations q1 and q2 using control points s1 and s2.

description:
Calculates the dot product of two quaternions. The closer the quaternions are to each other the more non-zero the value 
is (either positive or negative). Identical unit rotations have a dot product of +/-1.
name: dot

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: The dot product of q1 and q2.

examples:
<caption>Testing unit quaternions for equality.</caption>
var q1 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
var q2 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q2)); // true
var q3 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 359.95);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q3)); // false

var dot = Quat.dot(q1, q3);
print(dot); // -0.9999999403953552
var equal = Math.abs(1 - Math.abs(dot)) < 0.000001;
print(equal); // true

description: Prints to the program log a text label followed by a quaternion's pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The quaternion to print.
params.name: q

params.description: If true the angle values are printed in degrees, otherwise they are printed in radians.
params.name: asDegrees

examples:
<caption>Two ways of printing a label plus a quaternion's Euler angles.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 45, 0);

// Quaternion: dvec3(0.000000, 45.000004, 0.000000)
Quat.print("Quaternion:", quaternion,  true);

// Quaternion: {"x":0,"y":45.000003814697266,"z":0}
print("Quaternion: " + JSON.stringify(Quat.safeEulerAngles(quaternion)));

description:
Tests whether two quaternions are equal.

Note: The quaternions must be exactly equal in order for true to be returned; it is often better to use {@link Quat(0).dot|Quat.dot} and test for closeness to +/-1.
name: equal

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: true if the quaternions are equal, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Testing unit quaternions for equality.</caption>
var q1 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
var q2 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q2)); // true
var q3 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 359.95);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q3)); // false

var dot = Quat.dot(q1, q3);
print(dot); // -0.9999999403953552
var equal = Math.abs(1 - Math.abs(dot)) < 0.000001;
print(equal); // true

description:
Cancels out the roll and pitch component of a quaternion so that its completely horizontal with a yaw pointing in the 
given quaternion's direction.
name: cancelOutRollAndPitch

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: orientation with its roll and pitch canceled out.

examples:
<caption>Two ways of calculating a camera orientation in the x-z plane with a yaw pointing in the direction of
    a given quaternion.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);

var noRollOrPitch = Quat.cancelOutRollAndPitch(quaternion);
Quat.print("", noRollOrPitch, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 22.245995, 0.000000)

var front = Quat.getFront(quaternion);
var lookAt = Quat.lookAtSimple(Vec3.ZERO, { x: front.x, y: 0, z: front.z });
Quat.print("", lookAt, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 22.245996, 0.000000)

description: Cancels out the roll component of a quaternion so that its horizontal axis is level.
name: cancelOutRoll

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: orientation with its roll canceled out.

examples:
<caption>Two ways of calculating a camera orientation that points in the direction of a given quaternion but
    keeps the camera's horizontal axis level.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);

var noRoll = Quat.cancelOutRoll(quaternion);
Quat.print("", noRoll, true); // dvec3(-1.033004, 22.245996, -0.000000)

var front = Quat.getFront(quaternion);
var lookAt = Quat.lookAtSimple(Vec3.ZERO, front);
Quat.print("", lookAt, true); // dvec3(-1.033004, 22.245996, -0.000000)

description:

The Recording API makes and plays back recordings of voice and avatar movements. Playback may be done on a user's avatar or an assignment client agent (see the {@link Agent} API).
name: Recording

name: loadRecording

params.description: The ATP, HTTP, or file system URL of the recording to load.
params.name: url

params.description: The function to call upon completion.
params.name: callback

examples:
<caption>Load and play back a recording from the asset server.</caption>
var assetPath = Window.browseAssets();
print("Asset path: " + assetPath);

if (assetPath.slice(-4) === ".hfr") {
    Recording.loadRecording("atp:" + assetPath, function (success, url) {
        if (!success) {
            print("Error loading recording.");
            return;
        }
        Recording.startPlaying();
    });
}

description: Starts making a recording.

description:
Stops making a recording. The recording may be saved using {@link Recording.saveRecording|saveRecording} or 
{@link Recording.saveRecordingToAsset|saveRecordingToAsset}, or immediately played back with 
{@link Recording.loadLastRecording|loadLastRecording}.
name: stopRecording

description: Gets whether a recording is currently being made.
name: isRecording

returns.description: true if a recording is currently being made, false if one isn't.

description: Gets the duration of the recording currently being made or recently made, in seconds.
name: recorderElapsed

returns.description: The duration of the recording currently being made or recently made, in seconds.

description: Gets the default directory that recordings are saved in.
name: getDefaultRecordingSaveDirectory

returns.description: The default recording save directory.

examples:
<caption>Report the default save directory.</caption>
print("Default save directory: " + Recording.getDefaultRecordingSaveDirectory());

description: Saves the most recently made recording to a file.
name: saveRecording

params.description: The path and name of the file to save the recording to.
params.name: filename

examples:
<caption>Save a 5 second recording to a file.</caption>
Recording.startRecording();

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Recording.stopRecording();
    var filename = (new Date()).toISOString();  // yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ
    filename = filename.slice(0, -5).replace(/:/g, "").replace("T", "-") 
        + ".hfr";  // yyyymmmdd-hhmmss.hfr
    filename = Recording.getDefaultRecordingSaveDirectory() + filename;
    Recording.saveRecording(filename);
    print("Saved recording: " + filename);
}, 5000);

description: Called when a {@link Recording.saveRecordingToAsset} call is complete.
name: saveRecordingToAssetCallback

params.description: The URL of the recording stored in the asset server if successful, "" if unsuccessful. The URL has atp: as the scheme and the SHA256 hash as the filename (with no extension).
params.name: url

description: Saves the most recently made recording to the domain's asset server.
name: saveRecordingToAsset

params.description: The function to call upon completion.
params.name: callback

returns.description: true if the recording is successfully being saved, false if not.

examples:
<caption>Save a 5 second recording to the asset server.</caption>
function onSavedRecordingToAsset(url) {
    if (url === "") {
        print("Couldn't save recording.");
        return;
    }

    print("Saved recording: " + url);  // atp:SHA256

    var filename = (new Date()).toISOString();  // yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ
    filename = filename.slice(0, -5).replace(/:/g, "").replace("T", "-")
        + ".hfr";  // yyyymmmdd-hhmmss.hfr
    var hash = url.slice(4);  // Remove leading "atp:" from url.
    mappingPath = "/recordings/" + filename;
    Assets.setMapping(mappingPath, hash, function (error) {
        if (error) {
            print("Mapping error: " + error);
        }
    });
    print("Mapped recording: " + mappingPath);  // /recordings/filename
}

Recording.startRecording();

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Recording.stopRecording();
    var success = Recording.saveRecordingToAsset(onSavedRecordingToAsset);
    if (!success) {
        print("Couldn't save recording.");
    }
}, 5000);

description: Loads the most recently made recording and plays it back on your avatar.
name: loadLastRecording
examples:
<caption>Make a 5 second recording and immediately play it back on your avatar.</caption>
Recording.startRecording();

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    Recording.stopRecording();
    Recording.loadLastRecording();
}, 5000);

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts • Server Entity Scripts • Assignment Client Scripts

Plays or "injects" the content of an audio file.

Create using {@link Audio} API methods.
name: AudioInjector

properties.description: true if the audio is currently playing, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: playing

properties.description: The loudness in the last frame of audio, range 0.0 – 1.0. Read-only.
properties.name: loudness

properties.description: Configures how the injector plays the audio.
properties.name: options

description: Stops current playback, if any, and starts playing from the beginning.
name: restart

description: Stops audio playback.
name: stop
examples:
<caption>Stop playing a sound before it finishes.</caption>
var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");
var injector;
var injectorOptions = {
    position: MyAvatar.position
};

Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.
    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);
}, 1000);

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    injector.stop();
}, 2000);

description: Gets the current configuration of the audio injector.
name: getOptions

returns.description: Configuration of how the injector plays the audio.

description: Configures how the injector plays the audio.
name: setOptions

params.description: Configuration of how the injector plays the audio.
params.name: options

name: getLoudness

returns.description: The loudness of the most recent frame of audio played, range 0.0 – 1.0.

description: Gets whether or not the audio is currently playing.
name: isPlaying

returns.description: true if the audio is currently playing, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>See if a sound is playing.</caption>
var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");
var injector;
var injectorOptions = {
    position: MyAvatar.position
};

Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.
    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);
}, 1000);

Script.setTimeout(function () {
    print("Sound is playing: " + injector.isPlaying());
}, 2000);

description: Triggered when the audio has finished playing.
name: finished
examples:
<caption>Report when a sound has finished playing.</caption>
var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");
var injector;
var injectorOptions = {
    position: MyAvatar.position
};

Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.
    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);
    injector.finished.connect(function () {
        print("Finished playing sound");
    });
}, 1000);

params.description: The ID of the entity that the script is running in.
params.name: entityID

examples:
<caption>Get the ID of the entity that a client entity script is running in.</caption>
var entityScript = (function () {
    this.entityID = Uuid.NULL;

    this.preload = function (entityID) {
        this.entityID = entityID;
        print("Entity ID: " + this.entityID);
    };
});

var entityID = Entities.addEntity({
    type: "Box",
    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0, z: -5 })),
    dimensions: { x: 0.5, y: 0.5, z: 0.5 },
    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 },
    script: "(" + entityScript + ")",  // Could host the script on a Web server instead.
    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.
});

// First file: scriptA.js
print("This is script A");

// Second file: scriptB.js
print("This is script B");
Script.load("scriptA.js");

// If you run scriptB.js you should see both scripts in the Running Scripts dialog.
// And you should see the following output:
// This is script B
// This is script A

description:
Includes JavaScript from other files in the current script. If a callback is specified, the files are loaded and 
included asynchronously, otherwise they are included synchronously (i.e., script execution blocks while the files are 
included).
name: include

params.description: The URLs of the scripts to include. Each can be relative to the current script.
params.name: filenames

params.description:
The function to call back when the scripts have been included. It can be either the 
    name of a function or an in-line definition.
params.name: callback

description:
Includes JavaScript from another file in the current script. If a callback is specified, the file is loaded and included
asynchronously, otherwise it is included synchronously (i.e., script execution blocks while the file is included).
name: include

params.description: The URL of the script to include. It can be relative to the current script.
params.name: filename

params.description:
The function to call back when the script has been included. It can be either the 
    name of a function or an in-line definition.
params.name: callback

examples:
<caption>Include a script file asynchronously.</caption>
// First file: scriptA.js
print("This is script A");

// Second file: scriptB.js
print("This is script B");
Script.include("scriptA.js", function () {
    print("Script A has been included");
});

// If you run scriptB.js you should see only scriptB.js in the running scripts list.
// And you should see the following output:
// This is script B
// This is script A
// Script A has been included

description:
Supported Script Types: Interface Scripts • Client Entity Scripts • Avatar Scripts

Information on the scripts that are in the default scripts directory of the Interface installation. This is provided as a property of {@link ScriptDiscoveryService}.

The information provided reflects the subdirectory structure. Methods and signals are per QT's QAbstractItemModel class, with the following details:

  • A single column of data: columnCount(index) returns 1.
  • Data is provided for the following roles:
    RoleValueDescription
    Display0The directory or script file name.
    Path256The path and filename of the data item if it is a script, undefined if it is a directory.
  • Use null for the root directory's index.
name: ScriptsModel
examples:
<caption>List the first 2 levels of the scripts directory.</caption>
var MAX_DIRECTORY_LEVEL = 1;
var DISPLAY_ROLE = 0;
var PATH_ROLE = 256;

function printDirectory(parentIndex, directoryLevel, indent) {
    var numRows = ScriptDiscoveryService.scriptsModel.rowCount(parentIndex);
    for (var i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {
        var rowIndex = ScriptDiscoveryService.scriptsModel.index(i, 0, parentIndex);

        var name = ScriptDiscoveryService.scriptsModel.data(rowIndex, DISPLAY_ROLE);
        var hasChildren = ScriptDiscoveryService.scriptsModel.hasChildren(rowIndex);
        var path = hasChildren ? "" : ScriptDiscoveryService.scriptsModel.data(rowIndex, PATH_ROLE);

        print(indent + "- " + name + (hasChildren ? "" : " - " + path));

        if (hasChildren && directoryLevel < MAX_DIRECTORY_LEVEL) {
            printDirectory(rowIndex, directoryLevel + 1, indent + "    ");
        }
    }
}

print("Scripts:");
printDirectory(null, 0, "");  // null index for the root directory.
